00075 /* ------------------ osc extent ------------------ */
00076 static inline char *ext_flags(struct osc_extent *ext, char *flags)
00077 {
00078         char *buf = flags;
00079         *buf++ = ext->oe_rw ? 'r' : 'w';
00080         if (ext->oe_intree)
00081                 *buf++ = 'i';
00082         if (ext->oe_sync)
00083                 *buf++ = 'S';
00084         if (ext->oe_srvlock)
00085                 *buf++ = 's';
00086         if (ext->oe_hp)
00087                 *buf++ = 'h';
00088         if (ext->oe_urgent)
00089                 *buf++ = 'u';
00090         if (ext->oe_memalloc)
00091                 *buf++ = 'm';
00092         if (ext->oe_trunc_pending)
00093                 *buf++ = 't';
00094         if (ext->oe_fsync_wait)
00095                 *buf++ = 'Y';
00096         *buf = 0;
00097         return flags;
00098 }
00099 
00100 static inline char list_empty_marker(struct list_head *list)
00101 {
00102         return list_empty(list) ? '-' : '+';
00103 }
00104 
00105 #define EXTSTR       "[%lu -> %lu/%lu]"
00106 #define EXTPARA(ext) (ext)->oe_start, (ext)->oe_end, (ext)->oe_max_end
00107 static const char *oes_strings[] = {
00108         "inv", "active", "cache", "locking", "lockdone", "rpc", "trunc", NULL };
00109 
00110 #define OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(lvl, extent, fmt, ...) do {                           \
00111         struct osc_extent *__ext = (extent);                                  \
00112         char __buf[16];                                                       \
00113                                                                               \
00114         CDEBUG(lvl,                                                           \
00115                 "extent %p@{" EXTSTR ", "                                     \
00116                 "[%d|%d|%c|%s|%s|%p], [%d|%d|%c|%c|%p|%u|%p]} " fmt,          \
00117                 /* ----- extent part 0 ----- */                               \
00118                 __ext, EXTPARA(__ext),                                        \
00119                 /* ----- part 1 ----- */                                      \
00120                 atomic_read(&__ext->oe_refc),                         \
00121                 atomic_read(&__ext->oe_users),                        \
00122                 list_empty_marker(&__ext->oe_link),                           \
00123                 oes_strings[__ext->oe_state], ext_flags(__ext, __buf),        \
00124                 __ext->oe_obj,                                                \
00125                 /* ----- part 2 ----- */                                      \
00126                 __ext->oe_grants, __ext->oe_nr_pages,                         \
00127                 list_empty_marker(&__ext->oe_pages),                          \
00128                 waitqueue_active(&__ext->oe_waitq) ? '+' : '-',               \
00129                 __ext->oe_dlmlock, __ext->oe_mppr, __ext->oe_owner,           \
00130                 /* ----- part 4 ----- */                                      \
00131                 ## __VA_ARGS__);                                              \
00132         if (lvl == D_ERROR && __ext->oe_dlmlock != NULL)                      \
00133                 LDLM_ERROR(__ext->oe_dlmlock, "extent: %p", __ext);           \
00134         else                                                                  \
00135                 LDLM_DEBUG(__ext->oe_dlmlock, "extent: %p", __ext);           \
00136 } while (0)
00137 
00138 #undef EASSERTF
00139 #define EASSERTF(expr, ext, fmt, args...) do {                          \
00140         if (!(expr)) {                                                  \
00141                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, (ext), fmt, ##args);           \
00142                 osc_extent_tree_dump(D_ERROR, (ext)->oe_obj);           \
00143                 LASSERT(expr);                                          \
00144         }                                                               \
00145 } while (0)
00146 
00147 #undef EASSERT
00148 #define EASSERT(expr, ext) EASSERTF(expr, ext, "\n")

00150 static inline struct osc_extent *rb_extent(struct rb_node *n)
00151 {
00152         if (n == NULL)
00153                 return NULL;
00154 
00155         return container_of(n, struct osc_extent, oe_node);
00156 }
00157 
00158 static inline struct osc_extent *next_extent(struct osc_extent *ext)
00159 {
00160         if (ext == NULL)
00161                 return NULL;
00162 
00163         LASSERT(ext->oe_intree);
00164         return rb_extent(rb_next(&ext->oe_node));
00165 }
00166 
00167 static inline struct osc_extent *prev_extent(struct osc_extent *ext)
00168 {
00169         if (ext == NULL)
00170                 return NULL;
00171 
00172         LASSERT(ext->oe_intree);
00173         return rb_extent(rb_prev(&ext->oe_node));
00174 }
00175 
00176 static inline struct osc_extent *first_extent(struct osc_object *obj)
00177 {
00178         return rb_extent(rb_first(&obj->oo_root));
00179 }
00180 
00181 /* object must be locked by caller. */
00182 static int osc_extent_sanity_check0(struct osc_extent *ext,
00183                                     const char *func, const int line)
00184 {
00185         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00186         struct osc_async_page *oap;
00187         size_t page_count;
00188         int rc = 0;
00189 
00190         if (!osc_object_is_locked(obj))
00191                 GOTO(out, rc = 9);
00192 
00193         if (ext->oe_state >= OES_STATE_MAX)
00194                 GOTO(out, rc = 10);
00195 
00196         if (atomic_read(&ext->oe_refc) <= 0)
00197                 GOTO(out, rc = 20);
00198 
00199         if (atomic_read(&ext->oe_refc) < atomic_read(&ext->oe_users))
00200                 GOTO(out, rc = 30);
00201 
00202         switch (ext->oe_state) {
00203         case OES_INV:
00204                 if (ext->oe_nr_pages > 0 || !list_empty(&ext->oe_pages))
00205                         GOTO(out, rc = 35);
00206                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00207                 break;
00208         case OES_ACTIVE:
00209                 if (atomic_read(&ext->oe_users) == 0)
00210                         GOTO(out, rc = 40);
00211                 if (ext->oe_hp)
00212                         GOTO(out, rc = 50);
00213                 if (ext->oe_fsync_wait && !ext->oe_urgent)
00214                         GOTO(out, rc = 55);
00215                 break;
00216         case OES_CACHE:
00217                 if (ext->oe_grants == 0)
00218                         GOTO(out, rc = 60);
00219                 if (ext->oe_fsync_wait && !ext->oe_urgent && !ext->oe_hp)
00220                         GOTO(out, rc = 65);
00221         default:
00222                 if (atomic_read(&ext->oe_users) > 0)
00223                         GOTO(out, rc = 70);
00224         }
00225 
00226         if (ext->oe_max_end < ext->oe_end || ext->oe_end < ext->oe_start)
00227                 GOTO(out, rc = 80);
00228 
00229         if (ext->oe_sync && ext->oe_grants > 0)
00230                 GOTO(out, rc = 90);
00231 
00232         if (ext->oe_dlmlock != NULL && !ldlm_is_failed(ext->oe_dlmlock)) {
00233                 struct ldlm_extent *extent;
00234 
00235                 extent = &ext->oe_dlmlock->l_policy_data.l_extent;
00236                 if (!(extent->start <= cl_offset(osc2cl(obj), ext->oe_start) &&
00237                       extent->end   >= cl_offset(osc2cl(obj), ext->oe_max_end)))
00238                         GOTO(out, rc = 100);
00239 
00240                 if (!(ext->oe_dlmlock->l_granted_mode & (LCK_PW | LCK_GROUP)))
00241                         GOTO(out, rc = 102);
00242         }
00243 
00244         if (ext->oe_nr_pages > ext->oe_mppr)
00245                 GOTO(out, rc = 105);
00246 
00247         /* Do not verify page list if extent is in RPC. This is because an
00248          * in-RPC extent is supposed to be exclusively accessible w/o lock. */
00249         if (ext->oe_state > OES_CACHE)
00250                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00251 
00252         if (!extent_debug)
00253                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00254 
00255         page_count = 0;
00256         list_for_each_entry(oap, &ext->oe_pages, oap_pending_item) {
00257                 pgoff_t index = osc_index(oap2osc(oap));
00258                 ++page_count;
00259                 if (index > ext->oe_end || index < ext->oe_start)
00260                         GOTO(out, rc = 110);
00261         }
00262         if (page_count != ext->oe_nr_pages)
00263                 GOTO(out, rc = 120);
00264 
00265 out:
00266         if (rc != 0)
00267                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, ext,
00268                                 "%s:%d sanity check %p failed with rc = %d\n",
00269                                 func, line, ext, rc);
00270         return rc;
00271 }
00272 
00273 #define sanity_check_nolock(ext) \
00274         osc_extent_sanity_check0(ext, __func__, __LINE__)
00275 
00276 #define sanity_check(ext) ({                                                   \
00277         int __res;                                                             \
00278         osc_object_lock((ext)->oe_obj);                                        \
00279         __res = sanity_check_nolock(ext);                                      \
00280         osc_object_unlock((ext)->oe_obj);                                      \
00281         __res;                                                                 \
00282 })

00288 static int osc_extent_is_overlapped(struct osc_object *obj,
00289                                     struct osc_extent *ext)
00290 {
00291         struct osc_extent *tmp;
00292 
00293         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
00294 
00295         if (!extent_debug)
00296                 return 0;
00297 
00298         for (tmp = first_extent(obj); tmp != NULL; tmp = next_extent(tmp)) {
00299                 if (tmp == ext)
00300                         continue;
00301                 if (tmp->oe_end >= ext->oe_start &&
00302                     tmp->oe_start <= ext->oe_end)
00303                         return 1;
00304         }
00305         return 0;
00306 }
00307 
00308 static void osc_extent_state_set(struct osc_extent *ext, int state)
00309 {
00310         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(ext->oe_obj));
00311         LASSERT(state >= OES_INV && state < OES_STATE_MAX);
00312 
00313         /* Never try to sanity check a state changing extent :-) */
00314         /* LASSERT(sanity_check_nolock(ext) == 0); */
00315 
00316         /* TODO: validate the state machine */
00317         ext->oe_state = state;
00318         wake_up_all(&ext->oe_waitq);
00319 }
00320 
00321 static struct osc_extent *osc_extent_alloc(struct osc_object *obj)
00322 {
00323         struct osc_extent *ext;
00324 
00325         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(ext, osc_extent_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00326         if (ext == NULL)
00327                 return NULL;
00328 
00329         RB_CLEAR_NODE(&ext->oe_node);
00330         ext->oe_obj = obj;
00331         cl_object_get(osc2cl(obj));
00332         atomic_set(&ext->oe_refc, 1);
00333         atomic_set(&ext->oe_users, 0);
00334         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ext->oe_link);
00335         ext->oe_state = OES_INV;
00336         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ext->oe_pages);
00337         init_waitqueue_head(&ext->oe_waitq);
00338         ext->oe_dlmlock = NULL;
00339 
00340         return ext;
00341 }
00342 
00343 static void osc_extent_free(struct osc_extent *ext)
00344 {
00345         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(ext, osc_extent_kmem);
00346 }
00347 
00348 static struct osc_extent *osc_extent_get(struct osc_extent *ext)
00349 {
00350         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ext->oe_refc) >= 0);
00351         atomic_inc(&ext->oe_refc);
00352         return ext;
00353 }
00354 
00355 static void osc_extent_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_extent *ext)
00356 {
00357         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ext->oe_refc) > 0);
00358         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&ext->oe_refc)) {
00359                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ext->oe_link));
00360                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&ext->oe_users) == 0);
00361                 LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_INV);
00362                 LASSERT(!ext->oe_intree);
00363 
00364                 if (ext->oe_dlmlock != NULL) {
00365                         lu_ref_add(&ext->oe_dlmlock->l_reference,
00366                                    "osc_extent", ext);
00367                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(ext->oe_dlmlock);
00368                         ext->oe_dlmlock = NULL;
00369                 }
00370                 cl_object_put(env, osc2cl(ext->oe_obj));
00371                 osc_extent_free(ext);
00372         }
00373 }
00374 
00380 static void osc_extent_put_trust(struct osc_extent *ext)
00381 {
00382         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ext->oe_refc) > 1);
00383         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(ext->oe_obj));
00384         atomic_dec(&ext->oe_refc);
00385 }
00386 
00391 static struct osc_extent *osc_extent_search(struct osc_object *obj,
00392                                             pgoff_t index)
00393 {
00394         struct rb_node    *n = obj->oo_root.rb_node;
00395         struct osc_extent *tmp, *p = NULL;
00396 
00397         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
00398         while (n != NULL) {
00399                 tmp = rb_extent(n);
00400                 if (index < tmp->oe_start) {
00401                         n = n->rb_left;
00402                 } else if (index > tmp->oe_end) {
00403                         p = rb_extent(n);
00404                         n = n->rb_right;
00405                 } else {
00406                         return tmp;
00407                 }
00408         }
00409         return p;
00410 }
00411 
00412 /*
00413  * Return the extent covering @index, otherwise return NULL.
00414  * caller must have held object lock.
00415  */
00416 static struct osc_extent *osc_extent_lookup(struct osc_object *obj,
00417                                             pgoff_t index)
00418 {
00419         struct osc_extent *ext;
00420 
00421         ext = osc_extent_search(obj, index);
00422         if (ext != NULL && ext->oe_start <= index && index <= ext->oe_end)
00423                 return osc_extent_get(ext);
00424         return NULL;
00425 }
00426 
00427 /* caller must have held object lock. */
00428 static void osc_extent_insert(struct osc_object *obj, struct osc_extent *ext)
00429 {
00430         struct rb_node   **n      = &obj->oo_root.rb_node;
00431         struct rb_node    *parent = NULL;
00432         struct osc_extent *tmp;
00433 
00434         LASSERT(ext->oe_intree == 0);
00435         LASSERT(ext->oe_obj == obj);
00436         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
00437         while (*n != NULL) {
00438                 tmp = rb_extent(*n);
00439                 parent = *n;
00440 
00441                 if (ext->oe_end < tmp->oe_start)
00442                         n = &(*n)->rb_left;
00443                 else if (ext->oe_start > tmp->oe_end)
00444                         n = &(*n)->rb_right;
00445                 else
00446                         EASSERTF(0, tmp, EXTSTR"\n", EXTPARA(ext));
00447         }
00448         rb_link_node(&ext->oe_node, parent, n);
00449         rb_insert_color(&ext->oe_node, &obj->oo_root);
00450         osc_extent_get(ext);
00451         ext->oe_intree = 1;
00452 }
00453 
00454 /* caller must have held object lock. */
00455 static void osc_extent_erase(struct osc_extent *ext)
00456 {
00457         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00458         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
00459         if (ext->oe_intree) {
00460                 rb_erase(&ext->oe_node, &obj->oo_root);
00461                 ext->oe_intree = 0;
00462                 /* rbtree held a refcount */
00463                 osc_extent_put_trust(ext);
00464         }
00465 }
00466 
00467 static struct osc_extent *osc_extent_hold(struct osc_extent *ext)
00468 {
00469         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00470 
00471         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
00472         LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_ACTIVE || ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE);
00473         if (ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE) {
00474                 osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_ACTIVE);
00475                 osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_WRITE, -ext->oe_nr_pages);
00476         }
00477         atomic_inc(&ext->oe_users);
00478         list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
00479         return osc_extent_get(ext);
00480 }
00481 
00482 static void __osc_extent_remove(struct osc_extent *ext)
00483 {
00484         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(ext->oe_obj));
00485         LASSERT(list_empty(&ext->oe_pages));
00486         osc_extent_erase(ext);
00487         list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
00488         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_INV);
00489         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext, "destroyed.\n");
00490 }
00491 
00492 static void osc_extent_remove(struct osc_extent *ext)
00493 {
00494         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00495 
00496         osc_object_lock(obj);
00497         __osc_extent_remove(ext);
00498         osc_object_unlock(obj);
00499 }
00500 
00505 static int osc_extent_merge(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_extent *cur,
00506                             struct osc_extent *victim)
00507 {
00508         struct osc_object       *obj = cur->oe_obj;
00509         struct client_obd       *cli = osc_cli(obj);
00510         pgoff_t                  chunk_start;
00511         pgoff_t                  chunk_end;
00512         int                      ppc_bits;
00513 
00514         LASSERT(cur->oe_state == OES_CACHE);
00515         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
00516         if (victim == NULL)
00517                 return -EINVAL;
00518 
00519         if (victim->oe_state != OES_CACHE || victim->oe_fsync_wait)
00520                 return -EBUSY;
00521 
00522         if (cur->oe_max_end != victim->oe_max_end)
00523                 return -ERANGE;
00524 
00525         LASSERT(cur->oe_dlmlock == victim->oe_dlmlock);
00526         ppc_bits = osc_cli(obj)->cl_chunkbits - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00527         chunk_start = cur->oe_start >> ppc_bits;
00528         chunk_end   = cur->oe_end   >> ppc_bits;
00529         if (chunk_start   != (victim->oe_end >> ppc_bits) + 1 &&
00530             chunk_end + 1 != victim->oe_start >> ppc_bits)
00531                 return -ERANGE;
00532 
00533         /* overall extent size should not exceed the max supported limit
00534          * reported by the server */
00535         if (cur->oe_end - cur->oe_start + 1 +
00536             victim->oe_end - victim->oe_start + 1 > cli->cl_max_extent_pages)
00537                 return -ERANGE;
00538 
00539         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, victim, "will be merged by %p.\n", cur);
00540 
00541         cur->oe_start     = min(cur->oe_start, victim->oe_start);
00542         cur->oe_end       = max(cur->oe_end,   victim->oe_end);
00543         /* per-extent tax should be accounted only once for the whole extent */
00544         cur->oe_grants   += victim->oe_grants - cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
00545         cur->oe_nr_pages += victim->oe_nr_pages;
00546         /* only the following bits are needed to merge */
00547         cur->oe_urgent   |= victim->oe_urgent;
00548         cur->oe_memalloc |= victim->oe_memalloc;
00549         list_splice_init(&victim->oe_pages, &cur->oe_pages);
00550         list_del_init(&victim->oe_link);
00551         victim->oe_nr_pages = 0;
00552 
00553         osc_extent_get(victim);
00554         __osc_extent_remove(victim);
00555         osc_extent_put(env, victim);
00556 
00557         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, cur, "after merging %p.\n", victim);
00558         return 0;
00559 }
00560 
00564 int osc_extent_release(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_extent *ext)
00565 {
00566         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00567         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(obj);
00568         int rc = 0;
00569         ENTRY;
00570 
00571         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ext->oe_users) > 0);
00572         LASSERT(sanity_check(ext) == 0);
00573         LASSERT(ext->oe_grants > 0);
00574 
00575         if (atomic_dec_and_lock(&ext->oe_users, &obj->oo_lock)) {
00576                 LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_ACTIVE);
00577                 if (ext->oe_trunc_pending) {
00578                         /* a truncate process is waiting for this extent.
00579                          * This may happen due to a race, check
00580                          * osc_cache_truncate_start(). */
00581                         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_TRUNC);
00582                         ext->oe_trunc_pending = 0;
00583                 } else {
00584                         int grant = 0;
00585 
00586                         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_CACHE);
00587                         osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_WRITE,
00588                                            ext->oe_nr_pages);
00589 
00590                         /* try to merge the previous and next extent. */
00591                         if (osc_extent_merge(env, ext, prev_extent(ext)) == 0)
00592                                 grant += cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
00593                         if (osc_extent_merge(env, ext, next_extent(ext)) == 0)
00594                                 grant += cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
00595                         if (grant > 0)
00596                                 osc_unreserve_grant(cli, 0, grant);
00597 
00598                         if (ext->oe_urgent)
00599                                 list_move_tail(&ext->oe_link,
00600                                                &obj->oo_urgent_exts);
00601                 }
00602                 osc_object_unlock(obj);
00603 
00604                 osc_io_unplug_async(env, cli, obj);
00605         }
00606         osc_extent_put(env, ext);
00607         RETURN(rc);
00608 }
00609 
00610 static inline int overlapped(struct osc_extent *ex1, struct osc_extent *ex2)
00611 {
00612         return !(ex1->oe_end < ex2->oe_start || ex2->oe_end < ex1->oe_start);
00613 }
00614 
00619 static struct osc_extent *osc_extent_find(const struct lu_env *env,
00620                                           struct osc_object *obj, pgoff_t index,
00621                                           unsigned int *grants)
00622 {
00623         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(obj);
00624         struct osc_lock   *olck;
00625         struct cl_lock_descr *descr;
00626         struct osc_extent *cur;
00627         struct osc_extent *ext;
00628         struct osc_extent *conflict = NULL;
00629         struct osc_extent *found = NULL;
00630         pgoff_t    chunk;
00631         pgoff_t    max_end;
00632         unsigned int max_pages; /* max_pages_per_rpc */
00633         unsigned int chunksize;
00634         int        ppc_bits; /* pages per chunk bits */
00635         pgoff_t    chunk_mask;
00636         int        rc;
00637         ENTRY;
00638 
00639         cur = osc_extent_alloc(obj);
00640         if (cur == NULL)
00641                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00642 
00643         olck = osc_env_io(env)->oi_write_osclock;
00644         LASSERTF(olck != NULL, "page %lu is not covered by lock\n", index);
00645         LASSERT(olck->ols_state == OLS_GRANTED);
00646 
00647         descr = &olck->ols_cl.cls_lock->cll_descr;
00648         LASSERT(descr->cld_mode >= CLM_WRITE);
00649 
00650         LASSERT(cli->cl_chunkbits >= PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00651         ppc_bits   = cli->cl_chunkbits - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00652         chunk_mask = ~((1 << ppc_bits) - 1);
00653         chunksize  = 1 << cli->cl_chunkbits;
00654         chunk      = index >> ppc_bits;
00655 
00656         /* align end to rpc edge, rpc size may not be a power 2 integer. */
00657         max_pages = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc;
00658         LASSERT((max_pages & ~chunk_mask) == 0);
00659         max_end = index - (index % max_pages) + max_pages - 1;
00660         max_end = min_t(pgoff_t, max_end, descr->cld_end);
00661 
00662         /* initialize new extent by parameters so far */
00663         cur->oe_max_end = max_end;
00664         cur->oe_start   = index & chunk_mask;
00665         cur->oe_end     = ((index + ~chunk_mask + 1) & chunk_mask) - 1;
00666         if (cur->oe_start < descr->cld_start)
00667                 cur->oe_start = descr->cld_start;
00668         if (cur->oe_end > max_end)
00669                 cur->oe_end = max_end;
00670         cur->oe_grants  = 0;
00671         cur->oe_mppr    = max_pages;
00672         if (olck->ols_dlmlock != NULL) {
00673                 LASSERT(olck->ols_hold);
00674                 cur->oe_dlmlock = LDLM_LOCK_GET(olck->ols_dlmlock);
00675                 lu_ref_add(&olck->ols_dlmlock->l_reference, "osc_extent", cur);
00676         }
00677 
00678         /* grants has been allocated by caller */
00679         LASSERTF(*grants >= chunksize + cli->cl_grant_extent_tax,
00680                  "%u/%u/%u.\n", *grants, chunksize, cli->cl_grant_extent_tax);
00681         LASSERTF((max_end - cur->oe_start) < max_pages, EXTSTR"\n",
00682                  EXTPARA(cur));
00683 
00684 restart:
00685         osc_object_lock(obj);
00686         ext = osc_extent_search(obj, cur->oe_start);
00687         if (ext == NULL)
00688                 ext = first_extent(obj);
00689         while (ext != NULL) {
00690                 pgoff_t ext_chk_start = ext->oe_start >> ppc_bits;
00691                 pgoff_t ext_chk_end   = ext->oe_end   >> ppc_bits;
00692 
00693                 LASSERT(sanity_check_nolock(ext) == 0);
00694                 if (chunk > ext_chk_end + 1)
00695                         break;
00696 
00697                 /* if covering by different locks, no chance to match */
00698                 if (olck->ols_dlmlock != ext->oe_dlmlock) {
00699                         EASSERTF(!overlapped(ext, cur), ext,
00700                                  EXTSTR"\n", EXTPARA(cur));
00701 
00702                         ext = next_extent(ext);
00703                         continue;
00704                 }
00705 
00706                 /* discontiguous chunks? */
00707                 if (chunk + 1 < ext_chk_start) {
00708                         ext = next_extent(ext);
00709                         continue;
00710                 }
00711 
00712                 /* ok, from now on, ext and cur have these attrs:
00713                  * 1. covered by the same lock
00714                  * 2. contiguous at chunk level or overlapping. */
00715 
00716                 if (overlapped(ext, cur)) {
00717                         /* cur is the minimum unit, so overlapping means
00718                          * full contain. */
00719                         EASSERTF((ext->oe_start <= cur->oe_start &&
00720                                   ext->oe_end >= cur->oe_end),
00721                                  ext, EXTSTR"\n", EXTPARA(cur));
00722 
00723                         if (ext->oe_state > OES_CACHE || ext->oe_fsync_wait) {
00724                                 /* for simplicity, we wait for this extent to
00725                                  * finish before going forward. */
00726                                 conflict = osc_extent_get(ext);
00727                                 break;
00728                         }
00729 
00730                         found = osc_extent_hold(ext);
00731                         break;
00732                 }
00733 
00734                 /* non-overlapped extent */
00735                 if (ext->oe_state != OES_CACHE || ext->oe_fsync_wait) {
00736                         /* we can't do anything for a non OES_CACHE extent, or
00737                          * if there is someone waiting for this extent to be
00738                          * flushed, try next one. */
00739                         ext = next_extent(ext);
00740                         continue;
00741                 }
00742 
00743                 /* check if they belong to the same rpc slot before trying to
00744                  * merge. the extents are not overlapped and contiguous at
00745                  * chunk level to get here. */
00746                 if (ext->oe_max_end != max_end) {
00747                         /* if they don't belong to the same RPC slot or
00748                          * max_pages_per_rpc has ever changed, do not merge. */
00749                         ext = next_extent(ext);
00750                         continue;
00751                 }
00752 
00753                 /* check whether maximum extent size will be hit */
00754                 if ((ext_chk_end - ext_chk_start + 1 + 1) << ppc_bits >
00755                     cli->cl_max_extent_pages) {
00756                         ext = next_extent(ext);
00757                         continue;
00758                 }
00759 
00760                 /* it's required that an extent must be contiguous at chunk
00761                  * level so that we know the whole extent is covered by grant
00762                  * (the pages in the extent are NOT required to be contiguous).
00763                  * Otherwise, it will be too much difficult to know which
00764                  * chunks have grants allocated. */
00765 
00766                 /* try to do front merge - extend ext's start */
00767                 if (chunk + 1 == ext_chk_start) {
00768                         /* ext must be chunk size aligned */
00769                         EASSERT((ext->oe_start & ~chunk_mask) == 0, ext);
00770 
00771                         /* pull ext's start back to cover cur */
00772                         ext->oe_start   = cur->oe_start;
00773                         ext->oe_grants += chunksize;
00774                         *grants -= chunksize;
00775 
00776                         found = osc_extent_hold(ext);
00777                 } else if (chunk == ext_chk_end + 1) {
00778                         /* rear merge */
00779                         ext->oe_end     = cur->oe_end;
00780                         ext->oe_grants += chunksize;
00781                         *grants -= chunksize;
00782 
00783                         /* try to merge with the next one because we just fill
00784                          * in a gap */
00785                         if (osc_extent_merge(env, ext, next_extent(ext)) == 0)
00786                                 /* we can save extent tax from next extent */
00787                                 *grants += cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
00788 
00789                         found = osc_extent_hold(ext);
00790                 }
00791                 if (found != NULL)
00792                         break;
00793 
00794                 ext = next_extent(ext);
00795         }
00796 
00797         osc_extent_tree_dump(D_CACHE, obj);
00798         if (found != NULL) {
00799                 LASSERT(conflict == NULL);
00800                 if (!IS_ERR(found)) {
00801                         LASSERT(found->oe_dlmlock == cur->oe_dlmlock);
00802                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, found,
00803                                         "found caching ext for %lu.\n", index);
00804                 }
00805         } else if (conflict == NULL) {
00806                 /* create a new extent */
00807                 EASSERT(osc_extent_is_overlapped(obj, cur) == 0, cur);
00808                 cur->oe_grants = chunksize + cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
00809                 *grants -= cur->oe_grants;
00810                 LASSERT(*grants >= 0);
00811 
00812                 cur->oe_state = OES_CACHE;
00813                 found = osc_extent_hold(cur);
00814                 osc_extent_insert(obj, cur);
00815                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, cur, "add into tree %lu/%lu.\n",
00816                                 index, descr->cld_end);
00817         }
00818         osc_object_unlock(obj);
00819 
00820         if (conflict != NULL) {
00821                 LASSERT(found == NULL);
00822 
00823                 /* waiting for IO to finish. Please notice that it's impossible
00824                  * to be an OES_TRUNC extent. */
00825                 rc = osc_extent_wait(env, conflict, OES_INV);
00826                 osc_extent_put(env, conflict);
00827                 conflict = NULL;
00828                 if (rc < 0)
00829                         GOTO(out, found = ERR_PTR(rc));
00830 
00831                 goto restart;
00832         }
00833         EXIT;
00834 
00835 out:
00836         osc_extent_put(env, cur);
00837         LASSERT(*grants >= 0);
00838         return found;
00839 }
00840 
00844 int osc_extent_finish(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_extent *ext,
00845                       int sent, int rc)
00846 {
00847         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(ext->oe_obj);
00848         struct osc_async_page *oap;
00849         struct osc_async_page *tmp;
00850         int nr_pages = ext->oe_nr_pages;
00851         int lost_grant = 0;
00852         int blocksize = cli->cl_import->imp_obd->obd_osfs.os_bsize ? : 4096;
00853         loff_t last_off = 0;
00854         int last_count = -1;
00855         ENTRY;
00856 
00857         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext, "extent finished.\n");
00858 
00859         ext->oe_rc = rc ?: ext->oe_nr_pages;
00860         EASSERT(ergo(rc == 0, ext->oe_state == OES_RPC), ext);
00861 
00862         osc_lru_add_batch(cli, &ext->oe_pages);
00863         list_for_each_entry_safe(oap, tmp, &ext->oe_pages,
00864                                      oap_pending_item) {
00865                 list_del_init(&oap->oap_rpc_item);
00866                 list_del_init(&oap->oap_pending_item);
00867                 if (last_off <= oap->oap_obj_off) {
00868                         last_off = oap->oap_obj_off;
00869                         last_count = oap->oap_count;
00870                 }
00871 
00872                 --ext->oe_nr_pages;
00873                 osc_ap_completion(env, cli, oap, sent, rc);
00874         }
00875         EASSERT(ext->oe_nr_pages == 0, ext);
00876 
00877         if (!sent) {
00878                 lost_grant = ext->oe_grants;
00879         } else if (blocksize < PAGE_CACHE_SIZE &&
00880                    last_count != PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00881                 /* For short writes we shouldn't count parts of pages that
00882                  * span a whole chunk on the OST side, or our accounting goes
00883                  * wrong.  Should match the code in filter_grant_check. */
00884                 int offset = last_off & ~PAGE_MASK;
00885                 int count = last_count + (offset & (blocksize - 1));
00886                 int end = (offset + last_count) & (blocksize - 1);
00887                 if (end)
00888                         count += blocksize - end;
00889 
00890                 lost_grant = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - count;
00891         }
00892         if (ext->oe_grants > 0)
00893                 osc_free_grant(cli, nr_pages, lost_grant, ext->oe_grants);
00894 
00895         osc_extent_remove(ext);
00896         /* put the refcount for RPC */
00897         osc_extent_put(env, ext);
00898         RETURN(0);
00899 }
00900 
00901 static int extent_wait_cb(struct osc_extent *ext, enum osc_extent_state state)
00902 {
00903         int ret;
00904 
00905         osc_object_lock(ext->oe_obj);
00906         ret = ext->oe_state == state;
00907         osc_object_unlock(ext->oe_obj);
00908 
00909         return ret;
00910 }
00911 
00915 static int osc_extent_wait(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_extent *ext,
00916                            enum osc_extent_state state)
00917 {
00918         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00919         struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_time_seconds(600), NULL,
00920                                                   LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
00921         int rc = 0;
00922         ENTRY;
00923 
00924         osc_object_lock(obj);
00925         LASSERT(sanity_check_nolock(ext) == 0);
00926         /* `Kick' this extent only if the caller is waiting for it to be
00927          * written out. */
00928         if (state == OES_INV && !ext->oe_urgent && !ext->oe_hp) {
00929                 if (ext->oe_state == OES_ACTIVE) {
00930                         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
00931                 } else if (ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE) {
00932                         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
00933                         osc_extent_hold(ext);
00934                         rc = 1;
00935                 }
00936         }
00937         osc_object_unlock(obj);
00938         if (rc == 1)
00939                 osc_extent_release(env, ext);
00940 
00941         /* wait for the extent until its state becomes @state */
00942         rc = l_wait_event(ext->oe_waitq, extent_wait_cb(ext, state), &lwi);
00943         if (rc == -ETIMEDOUT) {
00944                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, ext,
00945                         "%s: wait ext to %u timedout, recovery in progress?\n",
00946                         cli_name(osc_cli(obj)), state);
00947 
00948                 lwi = LWI_INTR(NULL, NULL);
00949                 rc = l_wait_event(ext->oe_waitq, extent_wait_cb(ext, state),
00950                                   &lwi);
00951         }
00952         if (rc == 0 && ext->oe_rc < 0)
00953                 rc = ext->oe_rc;
00954         RETURN(rc);
00955 }
00956 
00961 static int osc_extent_truncate(struct osc_extent *ext, pgoff_t trunc_index,
00962                                 bool partial)
00963 {
00964         struct cl_env_nest     nest;
00965         struct lu_env         *env;
00966         struct cl_io          *io;
00967         struct osc_object     *obj = ext->oe_obj;
00968         struct client_obd     *cli = osc_cli(obj);
00969         struct osc_async_page *oap;
00970         struct osc_async_page *tmp;
00971         int                    pages_in_chunk = 0;
00972         int                    ppc_bits    = cli->cl_chunkbits -
00973                                              PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00974         __u64                  trunc_chunk = trunc_index >> ppc_bits;
00975         int                    grants   = 0;
00976         int                    nr_pages = 0;
00977         int                    rc       = 0;
00978         ENTRY;
00979 
00980         LASSERT(sanity_check(ext) == 0);
00981         LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_TRUNC);
00982         LASSERT(!ext->oe_urgent);
00983 
00984         /* Request new lu_env.
00985          * We can't use that env from osc_cache_truncate_start() because
00986          * it's from lov_io_sub and not fully initialized. */
00987         env = cl_env_nested_get(&nest);
00988         io  = &osc_env_info(env)->oti_io;
00989         io->ci_obj = cl_object_top(osc2cl(obj));
00990         rc = cl_io_init(env, io, CIT_MISC, io->ci_obj);
00991         if (rc < 0)
00992                 GOTO(out, rc);
00993 
00994         /* discard all pages with index greater than trunc_index */
00995         list_for_each_entry_safe(oap, tmp, &ext->oe_pages,
00996                                      oap_pending_item) {
00997                 pgoff_t index = osc_index(oap2osc(oap));
00998                 struct cl_page  *page = oap2cl_page(oap);
00999 
01000                 LASSERT(list_empty(&oap->oap_rpc_item));
01001 
01002                 /* only discard the pages with their index greater than
01003                  * trunc_index, and ... */
01004                 if (index < trunc_index ||
01005                     (index == trunc_index && partial)) {
01006                         /* accounting how many pages remaining in the chunk
01007                          * so that we can calculate grants correctly. */
01008                         if (index >> ppc_bits == trunc_chunk)
01009                                 ++pages_in_chunk;
01010                         continue;
01011                 }
01012 
01013                 list_del_init(&oap->oap_pending_item);
01014 
01015                 cl_page_get(page);
01016                 lu_ref_add(&page->cp_reference, "truncate", current);
01017 
01018                 if (cl_page_own(env, io, page) == 0) {
01019                         cl_page_discard(env, io, page);
01020                         cl_page_disown(env, io, page);
01021                 } else {
01022                         LASSERT(page->cp_state == CPS_FREEING);
01023                         LASSERT(0);
01024                 }
01025 
01026                 lu_ref_del(&page->cp_reference, "truncate", current);
01027                 cl_page_put(env, page);
01028 
01029                 --ext->oe_nr_pages;
01030                 ++nr_pages;
01031         }
01032         EASSERTF(ergo(ext->oe_start >= trunc_index + !!partial,
01033                       ext->oe_nr_pages == 0),
01034                 ext, "trunc_index %lu, partial %d\n", trunc_index, partial);
01035 
01036         osc_object_lock(obj);
01037         if (ext->oe_nr_pages == 0) {
01038                 LASSERT(pages_in_chunk == 0);
01039                 grants = ext->oe_grants;
01040                 ext->oe_grants = 0;
01041         } else { /* calculate how many grants we can free */
01042                 int     chunks = (ext->oe_end >> ppc_bits) - trunc_chunk;
01043                 pgoff_t last_index;
01044 
01045 
01046                 /* if there is no pages in this chunk, we can also free grants
01047                  * for the last chunk */
01048                 if (pages_in_chunk == 0) {
01049                         /* if this is the 1st chunk and no pages in this chunk,
01050                          * ext->oe_nr_pages must be zero, so we should be in
01051                          * the other if-clause. */
01052                         LASSERT(trunc_chunk > 0);
01053                         --trunc_chunk;
01054                         ++chunks;
01055                 }
01056 
01057                 /* this is what we can free from this extent */
01058                 grants          = chunks << cli->cl_chunkbits;
01059                 ext->oe_grants -= grants;
01060                 last_index      = ((trunc_chunk + 1) << ppc_bits) - 1;
01061                 ext->oe_end     = min(last_index, ext->oe_max_end);
01062                 LASSERT(ext->oe_end >= ext->oe_start);
01063                 LASSERT(ext->oe_grants > 0);
01064         }
01065         osc_object_unlock(obj);
01066 
01067         if (grants > 0 || nr_pages > 0)
01068                 osc_free_grant(cli, nr_pages, grants, grants);
01069 
01070 out:
01071         cl_io_fini(env, io);
01072         cl_env_nested_put(&nest, env);
01073         RETURN(rc);
01074 }
01075 
01080 static int osc_extent_make_ready(const struct lu_env *env,
01081                                  struct osc_extent *ext)
01082 {
01083         struct osc_async_page *oap;
01084         struct osc_async_page *last = NULL;
01085         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
01086         unsigned int page_count = 0;
01087         int rc;
01088         ENTRY;
01089 
01090         /* we're going to grab page lock, so object lock must not be taken. */
01091         LASSERT(sanity_check(ext) == 0);
01092         /* in locking state, any process should not touch this extent. */
01093         EASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_LOCKING, ext);
01094         EASSERT(ext->oe_owner != NULL, ext);
01095 
01096         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext, "make ready\n");
01097 
01098         list_for_each_entry(oap, &ext->oe_pages, oap_pending_item) {
01099                 ++page_count;
01100                 if (last == NULL || last->oap_obj_off < oap->oap_obj_off)
01101                         last = oap;
01102 
01103                 /* checking ASYNC_READY is race safe */
01104                 if ((oap->oap_async_flags & ASYNC_READY) != 0)
01105                         continue;
01106 
01107                 rc = osc_make_ready(env, oap, OBD_BRW_WRITE);
01108                 switch (rc) {
01109                 case 0:
01110                         spin_lock(&oap->oap_lock);
01111                         oap->oap_async_flags |= ASYNC_READY;
01112                         spin_unlock(&oap->oap_lock);
01113                         break;
01114                 case -EALREADY:
01115                         LASSERT((oap->oap_async_flags & ASYNC_READY) != 0);
01116                         break;
01117                 default:
01118                         LASSERTF(0, "unknown return code: %d\n", rc);
01119                 }
01120         }
01121 
01122         LASSERT(page_count == ext->oe_nr_pages);
01123         LASSERT(last != NULL);
01124         /* the last page is the only one we need to refresh its count by
01125          * the size of file. */
01126         if (!(last->oap_async_flags & ASYNC_COUNT_STABLE)) {
01127                 int last_oap_count = osc_refresh_count(env, last, OBD_BRW_WRITE);
01128                 LASSERT(last_oap_count > 0);
01129                 LASSERT(last->oap_page_off + last_oap_count <= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01130                 last->oap_count = last_oap_count;
01131                 spin_lock(&last->oap_lock);
01132                 last->oap_async_flags |= ASYNC_COUNT_STABLE;
01133                 spin_unlock(&last->oap_lock);
01134         }
01135 
01136         /* for the rest of pages, we don't need to call osf_refresh_count()
01137          * because it's known they are not the last page */
01138         list_for_each_entry(oap, &ext->oe_pages, oap_pending_item) {
01139                 if (!(oap->oap_async_flags & ASYNC_COUNT_STABLE)) {
01140                         oap->oap_count = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - oap->oap_page_off;
01141                         spin_lock(&oap->oap_lock);
01142                         oap->oap_async_flags |= ASYNC_COUNT_STABLE;
01143                         spin_unlock(&oap->oap_lock);
01144                 }
01145         }
01146 
01147         osc_object_lock(obj);
01148         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_RPC);
01149         osc_object_unlock(obj);
01150         /* get a refcount for RPC. */
01151         osc_extent_get(ext);
01152 
01153         RETURN(0);
01154 }
01155 
01161 static int osc_extent_expand(struct osc_extent *ext, pgoff_t index,
01162                              unsigned int *grants)
01163 {
01164         struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
01165         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(obj);
01166         struct osc_extent *next;
01167         int ppc_bits = cli->cl_chunkbits - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
01168         pgoff_t chunk = index >> ppc_bits;
01169         pgoff_t end_chunk;
01170         pgoff_t end_index;
01171         unsigned int chunksize = 1 << cli->cl_chunkbits;
01172         int rc = 0;
01173         ENTRY;
01174 
01175         LASSERT(ext->oe_max_end >= index && ext->oe_start <= index);
01176         osc_object_lock(obj);
01177         LASSERT(sanity_check_nolock(ext) == 0);
01178         end_chunk = ext->oe_end >> ppc_bits;
01179         if (chunk > end_chunk + 1)
01180                 GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
01181 
01182         if (end_chunk >= chunk)
01183                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01184 
01185         LASSERT(end_chunk + 1 == chunk);
01186 
01187         /* try to expand this extent to cover @index */
01188         end_index = min(ext->oe_max_end, ((chunk + 1) << ppc_bits) - 1);
01189 
01190         /* don't go over the maximum extent size reported by server */
01191         if (end_index - ext->oe_start + 1 > cli->cl_max_extent_pages)
01192                 GOTO(out, rc = -ERANGE);
01193 
01194         next = next_extent(ext);
01195         if (next != NULL && next->oe_start <= end_index)
01196                 /* complex mode - overlapped with the next extent,
01197                  * this case will be handled by osc_extent_find() */
01198                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
01199 
01200         ext->oe_end = end_index;
01201         ext->oe_grants += chunksize;
01202         *grants -= chunksize;
01203         LASSERT(*grants >= 0);
01204         EASSERTF(osc_extent_is_overlapped(obj, ext) == 0, ext,
01205                  "overlapped after expanding for %lu.\n", index);
01206         EXIT;
01207 
01208 out:
01209         osc_object_unlock(obj);
01210         RETURN(rc);
01211 }
01212 
01213 static void osc_extent_tree_dump0(int level, struct osc_object *obj,
01214                                   const char *func, int line)
01215 {
01216         struct osc_extent *ext;
01217         int cnt;
01218 
01219         CDEBUG(level, "Dump object %p extents at %s:%d, mppr: %u.\n",
01220                obj, func, line, osc_cli(obj)->cl_max_pages_per_rpc);
01221 
01222         /* osc_object_lock(obj); */
01223         cnt = 1;
01224         for (ext = first_extent(obj); ext != NULL; ext = next_extent(ext))
01225                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(level, ext, "in tree %d.\n", cnt++);
01226 
01227         cnt = 1;
01228         list_for_each_entry(ext, &obj->oo_hp_exts, oe_link)
01229                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(level, ext, "hp %d.\n", cnt++);
01230 
01231         cnt = 1;
01232         list_for_each_entry(ext, &obj->oo_urgent_exts, oe_link)
01233                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(level, ext, "urgent %d.\n", cnt++);
01234 
01235         cnt = 1;
01236         list_for_each_entry(ext, &obj->oo_reading_exts, oe_link)
01237                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(level, ext, "reading %d.\n", cnt++);
01238         /* osc_object_unlock(obj); */
01239 }
01240 
01241 /* ------------------ osc extent end ------------------ */
01242 
01243 static inline int osc_is_ready(struct osc_object *osc)
01244 {
01245         return !list_empty(&osc->oo_ready_item) ||
01246                !list_empty(&osc->oo_hp_ready_item);
01247 }
01248 
01249 #define OSC_IO_DEBUG(OSC, STR, args...)                                        \
01250         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "obj %p ready %d|%c|%c wr %d|%c|%c rd %d|%c " STR,     \
01251                (OSC), osc_is_ready(OSC),                                       \
01252                list_empty_marker(&(OSC)->oo_hp_ready_item),                    \
01253                list_empty_marker(&(OSC)->oo_ready_item),                       \
01254                atomic_read(&(OSC)->oo_nr_writes),                              \
01255                list_empty_marker(&(OSC)->oo_hp_exts),                          \
01256                list_empty_marker(&(OSC)->oo_urgent_exts),                      \
01257                atomic_read(&(OSC)->oo_nr_reads),                               \
01258                list_empty_marker(&(OSC)->oo_reading_exts),                     \
01259                ##args)
01260 
01261 static int osc_make_ready(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_async_page *oap,
01262                           int cmd)
01263 {
01264         struct osc_page *opg  = oap2osc_page(oap);
01265         struct cl_page  *page = oap2cl_page(oap);
01266         int result;
01267 
01268         LASSERT(cmd == OBD_BRW_WRITE); /* no cached reads */
01269 
01270         ENTRY;
01271         result = cl_page_make_ready(env, page, CRT_WRITE);
01272         if (result == 0)
01273                 opg->ops_submit_time = cfs_time_current();
01274         RETURN(result);
01275 }
01276 
01277 static int osc_refresh_count(const struct lu_env *env,
01278                              struct osc_async_page *oap, int cmd)
01279 {
01280         struct osc_page  *opg = oap2osc_page(oap);
01281         pgoff_t index = osc_index(oap2osc(oap));
01282         struct cl_object *obj;
01283         struct cl_attr   *attr = &osc_env_info(env)->oti_attr;
01284 
01285         int result;
01286         loff_t kms;
01287 
01288         /* readpage queues with _COUNT_STABLE, shouldn't get here. */
01289         LASSERT(!(cmd & OBD_BRW_READ));
01290         LASSERT(opg != NULL);
01291         obj = opg->ops_cl.cpl_obj;
01292 
01293         cl_object_attr_lock(obj);
01294         result = cl_object_attr_get(env, obj, attr);
01295         cl_object_attr_unlock(obj);
01296         if (result < 0)
01297                 return result;
01298         kms = attr->cat_kms;
01299         if (cl_offset(obj, index) >= kms)
01300                 /* catch race with truncate */
01301                 return 0;
01302         else if (cl_offset(obj, index + 1) > kms)
01303                 /* catch sub-page write at end of file */
01304                 return kms % PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01305         else
01306                 return PAGE_CACHE_SIZE;
01307 }
01308 
01309 static int osc_completion(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_async_page *oap,
01310                           int cmd, int rc)
01311 {
01312         struct osc_page   *opg  = oap2osc_page(oap);
01313         struct cl_page    *page = oap2cl_page(oap);
01314         enum cl_req_type   crt;
01315         int srvlock;
01316 
01317         ENTRY;
01318 
01319         cmd &= ~OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA;
01320         LASSERTF(equi(page->cp_state == CPS_PAGEIN,  cmd == OBD_BRW_READ),
01321                  "cp_state:%u, cmd:%d\n", page->cp_state, cmd);
01322         LASSERTF(equi(page->cp_state == CPS_PAGEOUT, cmd == OBD_BRW_WRITE),
01323                 "cp_state:%u, cmd:%d\n", page->cp_state, cmd);
01324         LASSERT(opg->ops_transfer_pinned);
01325 
01326         crt = cmd == OBD_BRW_READ ? CRT_READ : CRT_WRITE;
01327         /* Clear opg->ops_transfer_pinned before VM lock is released. */
01328         opg->ops_transfer_pinned = 0;
01329 
01330         opg->ops_submit_time = 0;
01331         srvlock = oap->oap_brw_flags & OBD_BRW_SRVLOCK;
01332 
01333         /* statistic */
01334         if (rc == 0 && srvlock) {
01335                 struct lu_device *ld    = opg->ops_cl.cpl_obj->co_lu.lo_dev;
01336                 struct osc_stats *stats = &lu2osc_dev(ld)->od_stats;
01337                 size_t bytes = oap->oap_count;
01338 
01339                 if (crt == CRT_READ)
01340                         stats->os_lockless_reads += bytes;
01341                 else
01342                         stats->os_lockless_writes += bytes;
01343         }
01344 
01345         /*
01346          * This has to be the last operation with the page, as locks are
01347          * released in cl_page_completion() and nothing except for the
01348          * reference counter protects page from concurrent reclaim.
01349          */
01350         lu_ref_del(&page->cp_reference, "transfer", page);
01351 
01352         cl_page_completion(env, page, crt, rc);
01353         cl_page_put(env, page);
01354 
01355         RETURN(0);
01356 }
01357 
01358 #define OSC_DUMP_GRANT(lvl, cli, fmt, args...) do {                     \
01359         struct client_obd *__tmp = (cli);                               \
01360         CDEBUG(lvl, "%s: grant { dirty: %ld/%ld dirty_pages: %ld/%lu "  \
01361                "dropped: %ld avail: %ld, dirty_grant: %ld, "            \
01362                "reserved: %ld, flight: %d } lru {in list: %ld, "        \
01363                "left: %ld, waiters: %d }" fmt "\n",                     \
01364                cli_name(__tmp),                                         \
01365                __tmp->cl_dirty_pages, __tmp->cl_dirty_max_pages,        \
01366                atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_pages), obd_max_dirty_pages, \
01367                __tmp->cl_lost_grant, __tmp->cl_avail_grant,             \
01368                __tmp->cl_dirty_grant,                                   \
01369                __tmp->cl_reserved_grant, __tmp->cl_w_in_flight,         \
01370                atomic_long_read(&__tmp->cl_lru_in_list),                \
01371                atomic_long_read(&__tmp->cl_lru_busy),                   \
01372                atomic_read(&__tmp->cl_lru_shrinkers), ##args);          \
01373 } while (0)
01374 
01375 /* caller must hold loi_list_lock */
01376 static void osc_consume_write_grant(struct client_obd *cli,
01377                                     struct brw_page *pga)
01378 {
01379         assert_spin_locked(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01380         LASSERT(!(pga->flag & OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT));
01381         atomic_long_inc(&obd_dirty_pages);
01382         cli->cl_dirty_pages++;
01383         pga->flag |= OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT;
01384         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "using %lu grant credits for brw %p page %p\n",
01385                PAGE_CACHE_SIZE, pga, pga->pg);
01386         osc_update_next_shrink(cli);
01387 }
01388 
01389 /* the companion to osc_consume_write_grant, called when a brw has completed.
01390  * must be called with the loi lock held. */
01391 static void osc_release_write_grant(struct client_obd *cli,
01392                                     struct brw_page *pga)
01393 {
01394         ENTRY;
01395 
01396         assert_spin_locked(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01397         if (!(pga->flag & OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT)) {
01398                 EXIT;
01399                 return;
01400         }
01401 
01402         pga->flag &= ~OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT;
01403         atomic_long_dec(&obd_dirty_pages);
01404         cli->cl_dirty_pages--;
01405         if (pga->flag & OBD_BRW_NOCACHE) {
01406                 pga->flag &= ~OBD_BRW_NOCACHE;
01407                 atomic_long_dec(&obd_dirty_transit_pages);
01408                 cli->cl_dirty_transit--;
01409         }
01410         EXIT;
01411 }
01412 
01419 static int osc_reserve_grant(struct client_obd *cli, unsigned int bytes)
01420 {
01421         int rc = -EDQUOT;
01422 
01423         if (cli->cl_avail_grant >= bytes) {
01424                 cli->cl_avail_grant    -= bytes;
01425                 cli->cl_reserved_grant += bytes;
01426                 rc = 0;
01427         }
01428         return rc;
01429 }
01430 
01431 static void __osc_unreserve_grant(struct client_obd *cli,
01432                                   unsigned int reserved, unsigned int unused)
01433 {
01434         /* it's quite normal for us to get more grant than reserved.
01435          * Thinking about a case that two extents merged by adding a new
01436          * chunk, we can save one extent tax. If extent tax is greater than
01437          * one chunk, we can save more grant by adding a new chunk */
01438         cli->cl_reserved_grant -= reserved;
01439         if (unused > reserved) {
01440                 cli->cl_avail_grant += reserved;
01441                 cli->cl_lost_grant  += unused - reserved;
01442                 cli->cl_dirty_grant -= unused - reserved;
01443         } else {
01444                 cli->cl_avail_grant += unused;
01445                 cli->cl_dirty_grant += reserved - unused;
01446         }
01447 }
01448 
01449 static void osc_unreserve_grant(struct client_obd *cli,
01450                                 unsigned int reserved, unsigned int unused)
01451 {
01452         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01453         __osc_unreserve_grant(cli, reserved, unused);
01454         if (unused > 0)
01455                 osc_wake_cache_waiters(cli);
01456         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01457 }
01458 
01472 static void osc_free_grant(struct client_obd *cli, unsigned int nr_pages,
01473                            unsigned int lost_grant, unsigned int dirty_grant)
01474 {
01475         unsigned long grant;
01476 
01477         grant = (1 << cli->cl_chunkbits) + cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
01478 
01479         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01480         atomic_long_sub(nr_pages, &obd_dirty_pages);
01481         cli->cl_dirty_pages -= nr_pages;
01482         cli->cl_lost_grant += lost_grant;
01483         cli->cl_dirty_grant -= dirty_grant;
01484         if (cli->cl_avail_grant < grant && cli->cl_lost_grant >= grant) {
01485                 /* borrow some grant from truncate to avoid the case that
01486                  * truncate uses up all avail grant */
01487                 cli->cl_lost_grant -= grant;
01488                 cli->cl_avail_grant += grant;
01489         }
01490         osc_wake_cache_waiters(cli);
01491         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01492         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "lost %u grant: %lu avail: %lu dirty: %lu/%lu\n",
01493                lost_grant, cli->cl_lost_grant,
01494                cli->cl_avail_grant, cli->cl_dirty_pages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
01495                cli->cl_dirty_grant);
01496 }
01497 
01502 static void osc_exit_cache(struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_async_page *oap)
01503 {
01504         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01505         osc_release_write_grant(cli, &oap->oap_brw_page);
01506         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01507 }
01508 
01513 static int osc_enter_cache_try(struct client_obd *cli,
01514                                struct osc_async_page *oap,
01515                                int bytes, int transient)
01516 {
01517         int rc;
01518 
01519         OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli, "need:%d\n", bytes);
01520 
01521         rc = osc_reserve_grant(cli, bytes);
01522         if (rc < 0)
01523                 return 0;
01524 
01525         if (cli->cl_dirty_pages < cli->cl_dirty_max_pages &&
01526             1 + atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_pages) <= obd_max_dirty_pages) {
01527                 osc_consume_write_grant(cli, &oap->oap_brw_page);
01528                 if (transient) {
01529                         cli->cl_dirty_transit++;
01530                         atomic_long_inc(&obd_dirty_transit_pages);
01531                         oap->oap_brw_flags |= OBD_BRW_NOCACHE;
01532                 }
01533                 rc = 1;
01534         } else {
01535                 __osc_unreserve_grant(cli, bytes, bytes);
01536                 rc = 0;
01537         }
01538         return rc;
01539 }
01540 
01541 static int ocw_granted(struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_cache_waiter *ocw)
01542 {
01543         int rc;
01544         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01545         rc = list_empty(&ocw->ocw_entry);
01546         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01547         return rc;
01548 }
01549 
01557 static int osc_enter_cache(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
01558                            struct osc_async_page *oap, int bytes)
01559 {
01560         struct osc_object       *osc = oap->oap_obj;
01561         struct lov_oinfo        *loi = osc->oo_oinfo;
01562         struct osc_cache_waiter  ocw;
01563         struct l_wait_info       lwi;
01564         int                      rc = -EDQUOT;
01565         ENTRY;
01566 
01567         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_time_seconds(AT_OFF ? obd_timeout : at_max),
01568                                NULL, LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
01569 
01570         OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli, "need:%d\n", bytes);
01571 
01572         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01573 
01574         /* force the caller to try sync io.  this can jump the list
01575          * of queued writes and create a discontiguous rpc stream */
01576         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_NO_GRANT) ||
01577             cli->cl_dirty_max_pages == 0 ||
01578             cli->cl_ar.ar_force_sync || loi->loi_ar.ar_force_sync) {
01579                 OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli, "forced sync i/o\n");
01580                 GOTO(out, rc = -EDQUOT);
01581         }
01582 
01583         /* Hopefully normal case - cache space and write credits available */
01584         if (osc_enter_cache_try(cli, oap, bytes, 0)) {
01585                 OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli, "granted from cache\n");
01586                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01587         }
01588 
01589         /* We can get here for two reasons: too many dirty pages in cache, or
01590          * run out of grants. In both cases we should write dirty pages out.
01591          * Adding a cache waiter will trigger urgent write-out no matter what
01592          * RPC size will be.
01593          * The exiting condition is no avail grants and no dirty pages caching,
01594          * that really means there is no space on the OST. */
01595         init_waitqueue_head(&ocw.ocw_waitq);
01596         ocw.ocw_oap   = oap;
01597         ocw.ocw_grant = bytes;
01598         while (cli->cl_dirty_pages > 0 || cli->cl_w_in_flight > 0) {
01599                 list_add_tail(&ocw.ocw_entry, &cli->cl_cache_waiters);
01600                 ocw.ocw_rc = 0;
01601                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01602 
01603                 osc_io_unplug_async(env, cli, NULL);
01604 
01605                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: sleeping for cache space @ %p for %p\n",
01606                        cli_name(cli), &ocw, oap);
01607 
01608                 rc = l_wait_event(ocw.ocw_waitq, ocw_granted(cli, &ocw), &lwi);
01609 
01610                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01611 
01612                 if (rc < 0) {
01613                         /* l_wait_event is interrupted by signal or timed out */
01614                         list_del_init(&ocw.ocw_entry);
01615                         break;
01616                 }
01617                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ocw.ocw_entry));
01618                 rc = ocw.ocw_rc;
01619 
01620                 if (rc != -EDQUOT)
01621                         break;
01622                 if (osc_enter_cache_try(cli, oap, bytes, 0)) {
01623                         rc = 0;
01624                         break;
01625                 }
01626         }
01627 
01628         switch (rc) {
01629         case 0:
01630                 OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli, "finally got grant space\n");
01631                 break;
01632         case -ETIMEDOUT:
01633                 OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli,
01634                                "timeout, fall back to sync i/o\n");
01635                 osc_extent_tree_dump(D_CACHE, osc);
01636                 /* fall back to synchronous I/O */
01637                 rc = -EDQUOT;
01638                 break;
01639         case -EINTR:
01640                 /* Ensures restartability - LU-3581 */
01641                 OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli, "interrupted\n");
01642                 rc = -ERESTARTSYS;
01643                 break;
01644         case -EDQUOT:
01645                 OSC_DUMP_GRANT(D_CACHE, cli,
01646                                "no grant space, fall back to sync i/o\n");
01647                 break;
01648         default:
01649                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s: event for cache space @ %p never arrived "
01650                        "due to %d, fall back to sync i/o\n",
01651                        cli_name(cli), &ocw, rc);
01652                 break;
01653         }
01654         EXIT;
01655 out:
01656         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01657         RETURN(rc);
01658 }
01659 
01660 /* caller must hold loi_list_lock */
01661 void osc_wake_cache_waiters(struct client_obd *cli)
01662 {
01663         struct list_head *l, *tmp;
01664         struct osc_cache_waiter *ocw;
01665 
01666         ENTRY;
01667         list_for_each_safe(l, tmp, &cli->cl_cache_waiters) {
01668                 ocw = list_entry(l, struct osc_cache_waiter, ocw_entry);
01669                 list_del_init(&ocw->ocw_entry);
01670 
01671                 ocw->ocw_rc = -EDQUOT;
01672                 /* we can't dirty more */
01673                 if ((cli->cl_dirty_pages  >= cli->cl_dirty_max_pages) ||
01674                     (1 + atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_pages) >
01675                      obd_max_dirty_pages)) {
01676                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "no dirty room: dirty: %ld "
01677                                "osc max %ld, sys max %ld\n",
01678                                cli->cl_dirty_pages, cli->cl_dirty_max_pages,
01679                                obd_max_dirty_pages);
01680                         goto wakeup;
01681                 }
01682 
01683                 if (osc_enter_cache_try(cli, ocw->ocw_oap, ocw->ocw_grant, 0))
01684                         ocw->ocw_rc = 0;
01685 wakeup:
01686                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "wake up %p for oap %p, avail grant %ld, %d\n",
01687                        ocw, ocw->ocw_oap, cli->cl_avail_grant, ocw->ocw_rc);
01688 
01689                 wake_up(&ocw->ocw_waitq);
01690         }
01691 
01692         EXIT;
01693 }
01694 
01695 static int osc_max_rpc_in_flight(struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_object *osc)
01696 {
01697         int hprpc = !!list_empty(&osc->oo_hp_exts);
01698         return rpcs_in_flight(cli) >= cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight + hprpc;
01699 }
01700 
01701 /* This maintains the lists of pending pages to read/write for a given object
01702  * (lop).  This is used by osc_check_rpcs->osc_next_obj() and osc_list_maint()
01703  * to quickly find objects that are ready to send an RPC. */
01704 static int osc_makes_rpc(struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_object *osc,
01705                          int cmd)
01706 {
01707         int invalid_import = 0;
01708         ENTRY;
01709 
01710         /* if we have an invalid import we want to drain the queued pages
01711          * by forcing them through rpcs that immediately fail and complete
01712          * the pages.  recovery relies on this to empty the queued pages
01713          * before canceling the locks and evicting down the llite pages */
01714         if ((cli->cl_import == NULL || cli->cl_import->imp_invalid))
01715                 invalid_import = 1;
01716 
01717         if (cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE) {
01718                 if (atomic_read(&osc->oo_nr_writes) == 0)
01719                         RETURN(0);
01720                 if (invalid_import) {
01721                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "invalid import forcing RPC\n");
01722                         RETURN(1);
01723                 }
01724                 if (!list_empty(&osc->oo_hp_exts)) {
01725                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "high prio request forcing RPC\n");
01726                         RETURN(1);
01727                 }
01728                 if (!list_empty(&osc->oo_urgent_exts)) {
01729                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "urgent request forcing RPC\n");
01730                         RETURN(1);
01731                 }
01732                 /* trigger a write rpc stream as long as there are dirtiers
01733                  * waiting for space.  as they're waiting, they're not going to
01734                  * create more pages to coalesce with what's waiting.. */
01735                 if (!list_empty(&cli->cl_cache_waiters)) {
01736                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "cache waiters forcing RPC\n");
01737                         RETURN(1);
01738                 }
01739                 if (atomic_read(&osc->oo_nr_writes) >=
01740                     cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc)
01741                         RETURN(1);
01742         } else {
01743                 if (atomic_read(&osc->oo_nr_reads) == 0)
01744                         RETURN(0);
01745                 if (invalid_import) {
01746                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "invalid import forcing RPC\n");
01747                         RETURN(1);
01748                 }
01749                 /* all read are urgent. */
01750                 if (!list_empty(&osc->oo_reading_exts))
01751                         RETURN(1);
01752         }
01753 
01754         RETURN(0);
01755 }
01756 
01757 static void osc_update_pending(struct osc_object *obj, int cmd, int delta)
01758 {
01759         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(obj);
01760         if (cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE) {
01761                 atomic_add(delta, &obj->oo_nr_writes);
01762                 atomic_add(delta, &cli->cl_pending_w_pages);
01763                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&obj->oo_nr_writes) >= 0);
01764         } else {
01765                 atomic_add(delta, &obj->oo_nr_reads);
01766                 atomic_add(delta, &cli->cl_pending_r_pages);
01767                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&obj->oo_nr_reads) >= 0);
01768         }
01769         OSC_IO_DEBUG(obj, "update pending cmd %d delta %d.\n", cmd, delta);
01770 }
01771 
01772 static int osc_makes_hprpc(struct osc_object *obj)
01773 {
01774         return !list_empty(&obj->oo_hp_exts);
01775 }
01776 
01777 static void on_list(struct list_head *item, struct list_head *list,
01778                     int should_be_on)
01779 {
01780         if (list_empty(item) && should_be_on)
01781                 list_add_tail(item, list);
01782         else if (!list_empty(item) && !should_be_on)
01783                 list_del_init(item);
01784 }
01785 
01786 /* maintain the osc's cli list membership invariants so that osc_send_oap_rpc
01787  * can find pages to build into rpcs quickly */
01788 static int __osc_list_maint(struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_object *osc)
01789 {
01790         if (osc_makes_hprpc(osc)) {
01791                 /* HP rpc */
01792                 on_list(&osc->oo_ready_item, &cli->cl_loi_ready_list, 0);
01793                 on_list(&osc->oo_hp_ready_item, &cli->cl_loi_hp_ready_list, 1);
01794         } else {
01795                 on_list(&osc->oo_hp_ready_item, &cli->cl_loi_hp_ready_list, 0);
01796                 on_list(&osc->oo_ready_item, &cli->cl_loi_ready_list,
01797                         osc_makes_rpc(cli, osc, OBD_BRW_WRITE) ||
01798                         osc_makes_rpc(cli, osc, OBD_BRW_READ));
01799         }
01800 
01801         on_list(&osc->oo_write_item, &cli->cl_loi_write_list,
01802                 atomic_read(&osc->oo_nr_writes) > 0);
01803 
01804         on_list(&osc->oo_read_item, &cli->cl_loi_read_list,
01805                 atomic_read(&osc->oo_nr_reads) > 0);
01806 
01807         return osc_is_ready(osc);
01808 }
01809 
01810 static int osc_list_maint(struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_object *osc)
01811 {
01812         int is_ready;
01813 
01814         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01815         is_ready = __osc_list_maint(cli, osc);
01816         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01817 
01818         return is_ready;
01819 }
01820 
01821 /* this is trying to propogate async writeback errors back up to the
01822  * application.  As an async write fails we record the error code for later if
01823  * the app does an fsync.  As long as errors persist we force future rpcs to be
01824  * sync so that the app can get a sync error and break the cycle of queueing
01825  * pages for which writeback will fail. */
01826 static void osc_process_ar(struct osc_async_rc *ar, __u64 xid,
01827                            int rc)
01828 {
01829         if (rc) {
01830                 if (!ar->ar_rc)
01831                         ar->ar_rc = rc;
01832 
01833                 ar->ar_force_sync = 1;
01834                 ar->ar_min_xid = ptlrpc_sample_next_xid();
01835                 return;
01836 
01837         }
01838 
01839         if (ar->ar_force_sync && (xid >= ar->ar_min_xid))
01840                 ar->ar_force_sync = 0;
01841 }
01842 
01843 /* this must be called holding the loi list lock to give coverage to exit_cache,
01844  * async_flag maintenance, and oap_request */
01845 static void osc_ap_completion(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
01846                               struct osc_async_page *oap, int sent, int rc)
01847 {
01848         struct osc_object *osc = oap->oap_obj;
01849         struct lov_oinfo  *loi = osc->oo_oinfo;
01850         __u64 xid = 0;
01851 
01852         ENTRY;
01853         if (oap->oap_request != NULL) {
01854                 xid = ptlrpc_req_xid(oap->oap_request);
01855                 ptlrpc_req_finished(oap->oap_request);
01856                 oap->oap_request = NULL;
01857         }
01858 
01859         /* As the transfer for this page is being done, clear the flags */
01860         spin_lock(&oap->oap_lock);
01861         oap->oap_async_flags = 0;
01862         spin_unlock(&oap->oap_lock);
01863         oap->oap_interrupted = 0;
01864 
01865         if (oap->oap_cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE && xid > 0) {
01866                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01867                 osc_process_ar(&cli->cl_ar, xid, rc);
01868                 osc_process_ar(&loi->loi_ar, xid, rc);
01869                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01870         }
01871 
01872         rc = osc_completion(env, oap, oap->oap_cmd, rc);
01873         if (rc)
01874                 CERROR("completion on oap %p obj %p returns %d.\n",
01875                        oap, osc, rc);
01876 
01877         EXIT;
01878 }
01879 
01885 static int try_to_add_extent_for_io(struct client_obd *cli,
01886                                     struct osc_extent *ext,
01887                                     struct list_head *rpclist,
01888                                     unsigned int *pc, unsigned int *max_pages)
01889 {
01890         struct osc_extent *tmp;
01891         struct osc_async_page *oap = list_first_entry(&ext->oe_pages,
01892                                                       struct osc_async_page,
01893                                                       oap_pending_item);
01894         ENTRY;
01895 
01896         EASSERT((ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE || ext->oe_state == OES_LOCK_DONE),
01897                 ext);
01898 
01899         *max_pages = max(ext->oe_mppr, *max_pages);
01900         if (*pc + ext->oe_nr_pages > *max_pages)
01901                 RETURN(0);
01902 
01903         list_for_each_entry(tmp, rpclist, oe_link) {
01904                 struct osc_async_page *oap2;
01905                 oap2 = list_first_entry(&tmp->oe_pages, struct osc_async_page,
01906                                         oap_pending_item);
01907                 EASSERT(tmp->oe_owner == current, tmp);
01908 #if 0
01909                 if (overlapped(tmp, ext)) {
01910                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, tmp, "overlapped %p.\n", ext);
01911                         EASSERT(0, ext);
01912                 }
01913 #endif
01914                 if (oap2cl_page(oap)->cp_type != oap2cl_page(oap2)->cp_type) {
01915                         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "Do not permit different type of IO"
01916                                         " for a same RPC\n");
01917                         RETURN(0);
01918                 }
01919 
01920                 if (tmp->oe_srvlock != ext->oe_srvlock ||
01921                     !tmp->oe_grants != !ext->oe_grants ||
01922                     tmp->oe_no_merge || ext->oe_no_merge)
01923                         RETURN(0);
01924 
01925                 /* remove break for strict check */
01926                 break;
01927         }
01928 
01929         *pc += ext->oe_nr_pages;
01930         list_move_tail(&ext->oe_link, rpclist);
01931         ext->oe_owner = current;
01932         RETURN(1);
01933 }
01934 
01948 static unsigned int get_write_extents(struct osc_object *obj,
01949                                       struct list_head *rpclist)
01950 {
01951         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(obj);
01952         struct osc_extent *ext;
01953         unsigned int page_count = 0;
01954         unsigned int max_pages = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc;
01955 
01956         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(obj));
01957         while (!list_empty(&obj->oo_hp_exts)) {
01958                 ext = list_entry(obj->oo_hp_exts.next, struct osc_extent,
01959                                  oe_link);
01960                 LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE);
01961                 if (!try_to_add_extent_for_io(cli, ext, rpclist, &page_count,
01962                                               &max_pages))
01963                         return page_count;
01964                 EASSERT(ext->oe_nr_pages <= max_pages, ext);
01965         }
01966         if (page_count == max_pages)
01967                 return page_count;
01968 
01969         while (!list_empty(&obj->oo_urgent_exts)) {
01970                 ext = list_entry(obj->oo_urgent_exts.next,
01971                                  struct osc_extent, oe_link);
01972                 if (!try_to_add_extent_for_io(cli, ext, rpclist, &page_count,
01973                                               &max_pages))
01974                         return page_count;
01975 
01976                 if (!ext->oe_intree)
01977                         continue;
01978 
01979                 while ((ext = next_extent(ext)) != NULL) {
01980                         if ((ext->oe_state != OES_CACHE) ||
01981                             (!list_empty(&ext->oe_link) &&
01982                              ext->oe_owner != NULL))
01983                                 continue;
01984
