01985                         if (!try_to_add_extent_for_io(cli, ext, rpclist,
01986                                                       &page_count, &max_pages))
01987                                 return page_count;
01988                 }
01989         }
01990         if (page_count == max_pages)
01991                 return page_count;
01992 
01993         ext = first_extent(obj);
01994         while (ext != NULL) {
01995                 if ((ext->oe_state != OES_CACHE) ||
01996                     /* this extent may be already in current rpclist */
01997                     (!list_empty(&ext->oe_link) && ext->oe_owner != NULL)) {
01998                         ext = next_extent(ext);
01999                         continue;
02000                 }
02001 
02002                 if (!try_to_add_extent_for_io(cli, ext, rpclist, &page_count,
02003                                               &max_pages))
02004                         return page_count;
02005 
02006                 ext = next_extent(ext);
02007         }
02008         return page_count;
02009 }
02010 
02011 static int
02012 osc_send_write_rpc(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
02013                    struct osc_object *osc)
02014 __must_hold(osc)
02015 {
02016         struct list_head   rpclist = LIST_HEAD_INIT(rpclist);
02017         struct osc_extent *ext;
02018         struct osc_extent *tmp;
02019         struct osc_extent *first = NULL;
02020         unsigned int page_count = 0;
02021         int srvlock = 0;
02022         int rc = 0;
02023         ENTRY;
02024 
02025         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(osc));
02026 
02027         page_count = get_write_extents(osc, &rpclist);
02028         LASSERT(equi(page_count == 0, list_empty(&rpclist)));
02029 
02030         if (list_empty(&rpclist))
02031                 RETURN(0);
02032 
02033         osc_update_pending(osc, OBD_BRW_WRITE, -page_count);
02034 
02035         list_for_each_entry(ext, &rpclist, oe_link) {
02036                 LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE ||
02037                         ext->oe_state == OES_LOCK_DONE);
02038                 if (ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE)
02039                         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_LOCKING);
02040                 else
02041                         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_RPC);
02042         }
02043 
02044         /* we're going to grab page lock, so release object lock because
02045          * lock order is page lock -> object lock. */
02046         osc_object_unlock(osc);
02047 
02048         list_for_each_entry_safe(ext, tmp, &rpclist, oe_link) {
02049                 if (ext->oe_state == OES_LOCKING) {
02050                         rc = osc_extent_make_ready(env, ext);
02051                         if (unlikely(rc < 0)) {
02052                                 list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
02053                                 osc_extent_finish(env, ext, 0, rc);
02054                                 continue;
02055                         }
02056                 }
02057                 if (first == NULL) {
02058                         first = ext;
02059                         srvlock = ext->oe_srvlock;
02060                 } else {
02061                         LASSERT(srvlock == ext->oe_srvlock);
02062                 }
02063         }
02064 
02065         if (!list_empty(&rpclist)) {
02066                 LASSERT(page_count > 0);
02067                 rc = osc_build_rpc(env, cli, &rpclist, OBD_BRW_WRITE);
02068                 LASSERT(list_empty(&rpclist));
02069         }
02070 
02071         osc_object_lock(osc);
02072         RETURN(rc);
02073 }
02074 
02085 static int
02086 osc_send_read_rpc(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
02087                   struct osc_object *osc)
02088 __must_hold(osc)
02089 {
02090         struct osc_extent *ext;
02091         struct osc_extent *next;
02092         struct list_head rpclist = LIST_HEAD_INIT(rpclist);
02093         unsigned int page_count = 0;
02094         unsigned int max_pages = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc;
02095         int rc = 0;
02096         ENTRY;
02097 
02098         LASSERT(osc_object_is_locked(osc));
02099         list_for_each_entry_safe(ext, next,
02100                                      &osc->oo_reading_exts, oe_link) {
02101                 EASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_LOCK_DONE, ext);
02102                 if (!try_to_add_extent_for_io(cli, ext, &rpclist, &page_count,
02103                                               &max_pages))
02104                         break;
02105                 osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_RPC);
02106                 EASSERT(ext->oe_nr_pages <= max_pages, ext);
02107         }
02108         LASSERT(page_count <= max_pages);
02109 
02110         osc_update_pending(osc, OBD_BRW_READ, -page_count);
02111 
02112         if (!list_empty(&rpclist)) {
02113                 osc_object_unlock(osc);
02114 
02115                 LASSERT(page_count > 0);
02116                 rc = osc_build_rpc(env, cli, &rpclist, OBD_BRW_READ);
02117                 LASSERT(list_empty(&rpclist));
02118 
02119                 osc_object_lock(osc);
02120         }
02121         RETURN(rc);
02122 }
02123 
02124 #define list_to_obj(list, item) ({                                            \
02125         struct list_head *__tmp = (list)->next;                               \
02126         list_del_init(__tmp);                                         \
02127         list_entry(__tmp, struct osc_object, oo_##item);                      \
02128 })
02129 
02130 /* This is called by osc_check_rpcs() to find which objects have pages that
02131  * we could be sending.  These lists are maintained by osc_makes_rpc(). */
02132 static struct osc_object *osc_next_obj(struct client_obd *cli)
02133 {
02134         ENTRY;
02135 
02136         /* First return objects that have blocked locks so that they
02137          * will be flushed quickly and other clients can get the lock,
02138          * then objects which have pages ready to be stuffed into RPCs */
02139         if (!list_empty(&cli->cl_loi_hp_ready_list))
02140                 RETURN(list_to_obj(&cli->cl_loi_hp_ready_list, hp_ready_item));
02141         if (!list_empty(&cli->cl_loi_ready_list))
02142                 RETURN(list_to_obj(&cli->cl_loi_ready_list, ready_item));
02143 
02144         /* then if we have cache waiters, return all objects with queued
02145          * writes.  This is especially important when many small files
02146          * have filled up the cache and not been fired into rpcs because
02147          * they don't pass the nr_pending/object threshhold */
02148         if (!list_empty(&cli->cl_cache_waiters) &&
02149             !list_empty(&cli->cl_loi_write_list))
02150                 RETURN(list_to_obj(&cli->cl_loi_write_list, write_item));
02151 
02152         /* then return all queued objects when we have an invalid import
02153          * so that they get flushed */
02154         if (cli->cl_import == NULL || cli->cl_import->imp_invalid) {
02155                 if (!list_empty(&cli->cl_loi_write_list))
02156                         RETURN(list_to_obj(&cli->cl_loi_write_list,
02157                                            write_item));
02158                 if (!list_empty(&cli->cl_loi_read_list))
02159                         RETURN(list_to_obj(&cli->cl_loi_read_list,
02160                                            read_item));
02161         }
02162         RETURN(NULL);
02163 }
02164 
02165 /* called with the loi list lock held */
02166 static void osc_check_rpcs(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli)
02167 __must_hold(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock)
02168 {
02169         struct osc_object *osc;
02170         int rc = 0;
02171         ENTRY;
02172 
02173         while ((osc = osc_next_obj(cli)) != NULL) {
02174                 struct cl_object *obj = osc2cl(osc);
02175                 struct lu_ref_link link;
02176 
02177                 OSC_IO_DEBUG(osc, "%lu in flight\n", rpcs_in_flight(cli));
02178 
02179                 if (osc_max_rpc_in_flight(cli, osc)) {
02180                         __osc_list_maint(cli, osc);
02181                         break;
02182                 }
02183 
02184                 cl_object_get(obj);
02185                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02186                 lu_object_ref_add_at(&obj->co_lu, &link, "check", current);
02187 
02188                 /* attempt some read/write balancing by alternating between
02189                  * reads and writes in an object.  The makes_rpc checks here
02190                  * would be redundant if we were getting read/write work items
02191                  * instead of objects.  we don't want send_oap_rpc to drain a
02192                  * partial read pending queue when we're given this object to
02193                  * do io on writes while there are cache waiters */
02194                 osc_object_lock(osc);
02195                 if (osc_makes_rpc(cli, osc, OBD_BRW_WRITE)) {
02196                         rc = osc_send_write_rpc(env, cli, osc);
02197                         if (rc < 0) {
02198                                 CERROR("Write request failed with %d\n", rc);
02199 
02200                                 /* osc_send_write_rpc failed, mostly because of
02201                                  * memory pressure.
02202                                  *
02203                                  * It can't break here, because if:
02204                                  *  - a page was submitted by osc_io_submit, so
02205                                  *    page locked;
02206                                  *  - no request in flight
02207                                  *  - no subsequent request
02208                                  * The system will be in live-lock state,
02209                                  * because there is no chance to call
02210                                  * osc_io_unplug() and osc_check_rpcs() any
02211                                  * more. pdflush can't help in this case,
02212                                  * because it might be blocked at grabbing
02213                                  * the page lock as we mentioned.
02214                                  *
02215                                  * Anyway, continue to drain pages. */
02216                                 /* break; */
02217                         }
02218                 }
02219                 if (osc_makes_rpc(cli, osc, OBD_BRW_READ)) {
02220                         rc = osc_send_read_rpc(env, cli, osc);
02221                         if (rc < 0)
02222                                 CERROR("Read request failed with %d\n", rc);
02223                 }
02224                 osc_object_unlock(osc);
02225 
02226                 osc_list_maint(cli, osc);
02227                 lu_object_ref_del_at(&obj->co_lu, &link, "check", current);
02228                 cl_object_put(env, obj);
02229 
02230                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02231         }
02232 }
02233 
02234 static int osc_io_unplug0(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
02235                           struct osc_object *osc, int async)
02236 {
02237         int rc = 0;
02238 
02239         if (osc != NULL && osc_list_maint(cli, osc) == 0)
02240                 return 0;
02241 
02242         if (!async) {
02243                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02244                 osc_check_rpcs(env, cli);
02245                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02246         } else {
02247                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "Queue writeback work for client %p.\n", cli);
02248                 LASSERT(cli->cl_writeback_work != NULL);
02249                 rc = ptlrpcd_queue_work(cli->cl_writeback_work);
02250         }
02251         return rc;
02252 }
02253 
02254 static int osc_io_unplug_async(const struct lu_env *env,
02255                                 struct client_obd *cli, struct osc_object *osc)
02256 {
02257         return osc_io_unplug0(env, cli, osc, 1);
02258 }
02259 
02260 void osc_io_unplug(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
02261                    struct osc_object *osc)
02262 {
02263         (void)osc_io_unplug0(env, cli, osc, 0);
02264 }
02265 
02266 int osc_prep_async_page(struct osc_object *osc, struct osc_page *ops,
02267                         struct page *page, loff_t offset)
02268 {
02269         struct obd_export     *exp = osc_export(osc);
02270         struct osc_async_page *oap = &ops->ops_oap;
02271         ENTRY;
02272 
02273         if (!page)
02274                 return cfs_size_round(sizeof(*oap));
02275 
02276         oap->oap_magic = OAP_MAGIC;
02277         oap->oap_cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
02278         oap->oap_obj = osc;
02279 
02280         oap->oap_page = page;
02281         oap->oap_obj_off = offset;
02282         LASSERT(!(offset & ~PAGE_MASK));
02283 
02284         if (!client_is_remote(exp) && cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE))
02285                 oap->oap_brw_flags = OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA;
02286 
02287         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oap->oap_pending_item);
02288         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&oap->oap_rpc_item);
02289 
02290         spin_lock_init(&oap->oap_lock);
02291         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "oap %p page %p obj off "LPU64"\n",
02292                oap, page, oap->oap_obj_off);
02293         RETURN(0);
02294 }
02295 
02296 int osc_queue_async_io(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
02297                        struct osc_page *ops)
02298 {
02299         struct osc_io *oio = osc_env_io(env);
02300         struct osc_extent     *ext = NULL;
02301         struct osc_async_page *oap = &ops->ops_oap;
02302         struct client_obd     *cli = oap->oap_cli;
02303         struct osc_object     *osc = oap->oap_obj;
02304         pgoff_t index;
02305         unsigned int tmp;
02306         unsigned int grants = 0;
02307         u32    brw_flags = OBD_BRW_ASYNC;
02308         int    cmd = OBD_BRW_WRITE;
02309         int    need_release = 0;
02310         int    rc = 0;
02311         ENTRY;
02312 
02313         if (oap->oap_magic != OAP_MAGIC)
02314                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02315 
02316         if (cli->cl_import == NULL || cli->cl_import->imp_invalid)
02317                 RETURN(-EIO);
02318 
02319         if (!list_empty(&oap->oap_pending_item) ||
02320             !list_empty(&oap->oap_rpc_item))
02321                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
02322 
02323         /* Set the OBD_BRW_SRVLOCK before the page is queued. */
02324         brw_flags |= ops->ops_srvlock ? OBD_BRW_SRVLOCK : 0;
02325         if (!client_is_remote(osc_export(osc)) &&
02326             cfs_capable(CFS_CAP_SYS_RESOURCE)) {
02327                 brw_flags |= OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA;
02328                 cmd |= OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA;
02329         }
02330 
02331         /* check if the file's owner/group is over quota */
02332         if (!(cmd & OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA)) {
02333                 struct cl_object *obj;
02334                 struct cl_attr   *attr;
02335                 unsigned int qid[MAXQUOTAS];
02336 
02337                 obj = cl_object_top(&osc->oo_cl);
02338                 attr = &osc_env_info(env)->oti_attr;
02339 
02340                 cl_object_attr_lock(obj);
02341                 rc = cl_object_attr_get(env, obj, attr);
02342                 cl_object_attr_unlock(obj);
02343 
02344                 qid[USRQUOTA] = attr->cat_uid;
02345                 qid[GRPQUOTA] = attr->cat_gid;
02346                 if (rc == 0 && osc_quota_chkdq(cli, qid) == NO_QUOTA)
02347                         rc = -EDQUOT;
02348                 if (rc)
02349                         RETURN(rc);
02350         }
02351 
02352         oap->oap_cmd = cmd;
02353         oap->oap_page_off = ops->ops_from;
02354         oap->oap_count = ops->ops_to - ops->ops_from;
02355         /* No need to hold a lock here,
02356          * since this page is not in any list yet. */
02357         oap->oap_async_flags = 0;
02358         oap->oap_brw_flags = brw_flags;
02359 
02360         OSC_IO_DEBUG(osc, "oap %p page %p added for cmd %d\n",
02361                      oap, oap->oap_page, oap->oap_cmd & OBD_BRW_RWMASK);
02362 
02363         index = osc_index(oap2osc(oap));
02364 
02365         /* Add this page into extent by the following steps:
02366          * 1. if there exists an active extent for this IO, mostly this page
02367          *    can be added to the active extent and sometimes we need to
02368          *    expand extent to accomodate this page;
02369          * 2. otherwise, a new extent will be allocated. */
02370 
02371         ext = oio->oi_active;
02372         if (ext != NULL && ext->oe_start <= index && ext->oe_max_end >= index) {
02373                 /* one chunk plus extent overhead must be enough to write this
02374                  * page */
02375                 grants = (1 << cli->cl_chunkbits) + cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
02376                 if (ext->oe_end >= index)
02377                         grants = 0;
02378 
02379                 /* it doesn't need any grant to dirty this page */
02380                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02381                 rc = osc_enter_cache_try(cli, oap, grants, 0);
02382                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02383                 if (rc == 0) { /* try failed */
02384                         grants = 0;
02385                         need_release = 1;
02386                 } else if (ext->oe_end < index) {
02387                         tmp = grants;
02388                         /* try to expand this extent */
02389                         rc = osc_extent_expand(ext, index, &tmp);
02390                         if (rc < 0) {
02391                                 need_release = 1;
02392                                 /* don't free reserved grant */
02393                         } else {
02394                                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext,
02395                                                 "expanded for %lu.\n", index);
02396                                 osc_unreserve_grant(cli, grants, tmp);
02397                                 grants = 0;
02398                         }
02399                 }
02400                 rc = 0;
02401         } else if (ext != NULL) {
02402                 /* index is located outside of active extent */
02403                 need_release = 1;
02404         }
02405         if (need_release) {
02406                 osc_extent_release(env, ext);
02407                 oio->oi_active = NULL;
02408                 ext = NULL;
02409         }
02410 
02411         if (ext == NULL) {
02412                 tmp = (1 << cli->cl_chunkbits) + cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
02413 
02414                 /* try to find new extent to cover this page */
02415                 LASSERT(oio->oi_active == NULL);
02416                 /* we may have allocated grant for this page if we failed
02417                  * to expand the previous active extent. */
02418                 LASSERT(ergo(grants > 0, grants >= tmp));
02419 
02420                 rc = 0;
02421                 if (grants == 0) {
02422                         /* we haven't allocated grant for this page. */
02423                         rc = osc_enter_cache(env, cli, oap, tmp);
02424                         if (rc == 0)
02425                                 grants = tmp;
02426                 }
02427 
02428                 tmp = grants;
02429                 if (rc == 0) {
02430                         ext = osc_extent_find(env, osc, index, &tmp);
02431                         if (IS_ERR(ext)) {
02432                                 LASSERT(tmp == grants);
02433                                 osc_exit_cache(cli, oap);
02434                                 rc = PTR_ERR(ext);
02435                                 ext = NULL;
02436                         } else {
02437                                 oio->oi_active = ext;
02438                         }
02439                 }
02440                 if (grants > 0)
02441                         osc_unreserve_grant(cli, grants, tmp);
02442         }
02443 
02444         LASSERT(ergo(rc == 0, ext != NULL));
02445         if (ext != NULL) {
02446                 EASSERTF(ext->oe_end >= index && ext->oe_start <= index,
02447                          ext, "index = %lu.\n", index);
02448                 LASSERT((oap->oap_brw_flags & OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT) != 0);
02449 
02450                 osc_object_lock(osc);
02451                 if (ext->oe_nr_pages == 0)
02452                         ext->oe_srvlock = ops->ops_srvlock;
02453                 else
02454                         LASSERT(ext->oe_srvlock == ops->ops_srvlock);
02455                 ++ext->oe_nr_pages;
02456                 list_add_tail(&oap->oap_pending_item, &ext->oe_pages);
02457                 osc_object_unlock(osc);
02458         }
02459         RETURN(rc);
02460 }
02461 
02462 int osc_teardown_async_page(const struct lu_env *env,
02463                             struct osc_object *obj, struct osc_page *ops)
02464 {
02465         struct osc_async_page *oap = &ops->ops_oap;
02466         int rc = 0;
02467         ENTRY;
02468 
02469         LASSERT(oap->oap_magic == OAP_MAGIC);
02470 
02471         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "teardown oap %p page %p at index %lu.\n",
02472                oap, ops, osc_index(oap2osc(oap)));
02473 
02474         if (!list_empty(&oap->oap_rpc_item)) {
02475                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "oap %p is not in cache.\n", oap);
02476                 rc = -EBUSY;
02477         } else if (!list_empty(&oap->oap_pending_item)) {
02478                 struct osc_extent *ext = NULL;
02479 
02480                 osc_object_lock(obj);
02481                 ext = osc_extent_lookup(obj, osc_index(oap2osc(oap)));
02482                 osc_object_unlock(obj);
02483                 /* only truncated pages are allowed to be taken out.
02484                  * See osc_extent_truncate() and osc_cache_truncate_start()
02485                  * for details. */
02486                 if (ext != NULL && ext->oe_state != OES_TRUNC) {
02487                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, ext, "trunc at %lu.\n",
02488                                         osc_index(oap2osc(oap)));
02489                         rc = -EBUSY;
02490                 }
02491                 if (ext != NULL)
02492                         osc_extent_put(env, ext);
02493         }
02494         RETURN(rc);
02495 }
02496 
02504 int osc_flush_async_page(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
02505                          struct osc_page *ops)
02506 {
02507         struct osc_extent *ext   = NULL;
02508         struct osc_object *obj   = cl2osc(ops->ops_cl.cpl_obj);
02509         struct cl_page    *cp    = ops->ops_cl.cpl_page;
02510         pgoff_t            index = osc_index(ops);
02511         struct osc_async_page *oap = &ops->ops_oap;
02512         bool unplug = false;
02513         int rc = 0;
02514         ENTRY;
02515 
02516         osc_object_lock(obj);
02517         ext = osc_extent_lookup(obj, index);
02518         if (ext == NULL) {
02519                 osc_extent_tree_dump(D_ERROR, obj);
02520                 LASSERTF(0, "page index %lu is NOT covered.\n", index);
02521         }
02522 
02523         switch (ext->oe_state) {
02524         case OES_RPC:
02525         case OES_LOCK_DONE:
02526                 CL_PAGE_DEBUG(D_ERROR, env, cp, "flush an in-rpc page?\n");
02527                 LASSERT(0);
02528                 break;
02529         case OES_LOCKING:
02530                 /* If we know this extent is being written out, we should abort
02531                  * so that the writer can make this page ready. Otherwise, there
02532                  * exists a deadlock problem because other process can wait for
02533                  * page writeback bit holding page lock; and meanwhile in
02534                  * vvp_page_make_ready(), we need to grab page lock before
02535                  * really sending the RPC. */
02536         case OES_TRUNC:
02537                 /* race with truncate, page will be redirtied */
02538         case OES_ACTIVE:
02539                 /* The extent is active so we need to abort and let the caller
02540                  * re-dirty the page. If we continued on here, and we were the
02541                  * one making the extent active, we could deadlock waiting for
02542                  * the page writeback to clear but it won't because the extent
02543                  * is active and won't be written out. */
02544                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
02545         default:
02546                 break;
02547         }
02548 
02549         rc = cl_page_prep(env, io, cp, CRT_WRITE);
02550         if (rc)
02551                 GOTO(out, rc);
02552 
02553         spin_lock(&oap->oap_lock);
02554         oap->oap_async_flags |= ASYNC_READY|ASYNC_URGENT;
02555         spin_unlock(&oap->oap_lock);
02556 
02557         if (memory_pressure_get())
02558                 ext->oe_memalloc = 1;
02559 
02560         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
02561         if (ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE) {
02562                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext,
02563                                 "flush page %p make it urgent.\n", oap);
02564                 if (list_empty(&ext->oe_link))
02565                         list_add_tail(&ext->oe_link, &obj->oo_urgent_exts);
02566                 unplug = true;
02567         }
02568         rc = 0;
02569         EXIT;
02570 
02571 out:
02572         osc_object_unlock(obj);
02573         osc_extent_put(env, ext);
02574         if (unplug)
02575                 osc_io_unplug_async(env, osc_cli(obj), obj);
02576         return rc;
02577 }
02578 
02586 int osc_cancel_async_page(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_page *ops)
02587 {
02588         struct osc_async_page *oap = &ops->ops_oap;
02589         struct osc_object     *obj = oap->oap_obj;
02590         struct client_obd     *cli = osc_cli(obj);
02591         struct osc_extent     *ext;
02592         struct osc_extent     *found = NULL;
02593         struct list_head            *plist;
02594         pgoff_t index = osc_index(ops);
02595         int     rc = -EBUSY;
02596         int     cmd;
02597         ENTRY;
02598 
02599         LASSERT(!oap->oap_interrupted);
02600         oap->oap_interrupted = 1;
02601 
02602         /* Find out the caching extent */
02603         osc_object_lock(obj);
02604         if (oap->oap_cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE) {
02605                 plist = &obj->oo_urgent_exts;
02606                 cmd   = OBD_BRW_WRITE;
02607         } else {
02608                 plist = &obj->oo_reading_exts;
02609                 cmd   = OBD_BRW_READ;
02610         }
02611         list_for_each_entry(ext, plist, oe_link) {
02612                 if (ext->oe_start <= index && ext->oe_end >= index) {
02613                         LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_LOCK_DONE);
02614                         /* For OES_LOCK_DONE state extent, it has already held
02615                          * a refcount for RPC. */
02616                         found = osc_extent_get(ext);
02617                         break;
02618                 }
02619         }
02620         if (found != NULL) {
02621                 list_del_init(&found->oe_link);
02622                 osc_update_pending(obj, cmd, -found->oe_nr_pages);
02623                 osc_object_unlock(obj);
02624 
02625                 osc_extent_finish(env, found, 0, -EINTR);
02626                 osc_extent_put(env, found);
02627                 rc = 0;
02628         } else {
02629                 osc_object_unlock(obj);
02630                 /* ok, it's been put in an rpc. only one oap gets a request
02631                  * reference */
02632                 if (oap->oap_request != NULL) {
02633                         ptlrpc_mark_interrupted(oap->oap_request);
02634                         ptlrpcd_wake(oap->oap_request);
02635                         ptlrpc_req_finished(oap->oap_request);
02636                         oap->oap_request = NULL;
02637                 }
02638         }
02639 
02640         osc_list_maint(cli, obj);
02641         RETURN(rc);
02642 }
02643 
02644 int osc_queue_sync_pages(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_object *obj,
02645                          struct list_head *list, int cmd, int brw_flags)
02646 {
02647         struct client_obd     *cli = osc_cli(obj);
02648         struct osc_extent     *ext;
02649         struct osc_async_page *oap;
02650         int     page_count = 0;
02651         int     mppr       = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc;
02652         bool    can_merge   = true;
02653         pgoff_t start      = CL_PAGE_EOF;
02654         pgoff_t end        = 0;
02655         ENTRY;
02656 
02657         list_for_each_entry(oap, list, oap_pending_item) {
02658                 struct osc_page *opg = oap2osc_page(oap);
02659                 pgoff_t index = osc_index(opg);
02660 
02661                 if (index > end)
02662                         end = index;
02663                 if (index < start)
02664                         start = index;
02665                 ++page_count;
02666                 mppr <<= (page_count > mppr);
02667 
02668                 if (unlikely(opg->ops_from > 0 || opg->ops_to < PAGE_SIZE))
02669                         can_merge = false;
02670         }
02671 
02672         ext = osc_extent_alloc(obj);
02673         if (ext == NULL) {
02674                 struct osc_async_page *tmp;
02675 
02676                 list_for_each_entry_safe(oap, tmp, list, oap_pending_item) {
02677                         list_del_init(&oap->oap_pending_item);
02678                         osc_ap_completion(env, cli, oap, 0, -ENOMEM);
02679                 }
02680                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02681         }
02682 
02683         ext->oe_rw = !!(cmd & OBD_BRW_READ);
02684         ext->oe_sync = 1;
02685         ext->oe_no_merge = !can_merge;
02686         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
02687         ext->oe_start = start;
02688         ext->oe_end = ext->oe_max_end = end;
02689         ext->oe_obj = obj;
02690         ext->oe_srvlock = !!(brw_flags & OBD_BRW_SRVLOCK);
02691         ext->oe_nr_pages = page_count;
02692         ext->oe_mppr = mppr;
02693         list_splice_init(list, &ext->oe_pages);
02694 
02695         osc_object_lock(obj);
02696         /* Reuse the initial refcount for RPC, don't drop it */
02697         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_LOCK_DONE);
02698         if (cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE) {
02699                 list_add_tail(&ext->oe_link, &obj->oo_urgent_exts);
02700                 osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_WRITE, page_count);
02701         } else {
02702                 list_add_tail(&ext->oe_link, &obj->oo_reading_exts);
02703                 osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_READ, page_count);
02704         }
02705         osc_object_unlock(obj);
02706 
02707         osc_io_unplug_async(env, cli, obj);
02708         RETURN(0);
02709 }
02710 
02714 int osc_cache_truncate_start(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_object *obj,
02715                              __u64 size, struct osc_extent **extp)
02716 {
02717         struct client_obd *cli = osc_cli(obj);
02718         struct osc_extent *ext;
02719         struct osc_extent *waiting = NULL;
02720         pgoff_t index;
02721         struct list_head list = LIST_HEAD_INIT(list);
02722         int result = 0;
02723         bool partial;
02724         ENTRY;
02725 
02726         /* pages with index greater or equal to index will be truncated. */
02727         index = cl_index(osc2cl(obj), size);
02728         partial = size > cl_offset(osc2cl(obj), index);
02729 
02730 again:
02731         osc_object_lock(obj);
02732         ext = osc_extent_search(obj, index);
02733         if (ext == NULL)
02734                 ext = first_extent(obj);
02735         else if (ext->oe_end < index)
02736                 ext = next_extent(ext);
02737         while (ext != NULL) {
02738                 EASSERT(ext->oe_state != OES_TRUNC, ext);
02739 
02740                 if (ext->oe_state > OES_CACHE || ext->oe_urgent) {
02741                         /* if ext is in urgent state, it means there must exist
02742                          * a page already having been flushed by write_page().
02743                          * We have to wait for this extent because we can't
02744                          * truncate that page. */
02745                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext,
02746                                         "waiting for busy extent\n");
02747                         waiting = osc_extent_get(ext);
02748                         break;
02749                 }
02750 
02751                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext, "try to trunc:"LPU64".\n", size);
02752 
02753                 osc_extent_get(ext);
02754                 if (ext->oe_state == OES_ACTIVE) {
02755                         /* though we grab inode mutex for write path, but we
02756                          * release it before releasing extent(in osc_io_end()),
02757                          * so there is a race window that an extent is still
02758                          * in OES_ACTIVE when truncate starts. */
02759                         LASSERT(!ext->oe_trunc_pending);
02760                         ext->oe_trunc_pending = 1;
02761                 } else {
02762                         EASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE, ext);
02763                         osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_TRUNC);
02764                         osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_WRITE,
02765                                            -ext->oe_nr_pages);
02766                 }
02767                 EASSERT(list_empty(&ext->oe_link), ext);
02768                 list_add_tail(&ext->oe_link, &list);
02769 
02770                 ext = next_extent(ext);
02771         }
02772         osc_object_unlock(obj);
02773 
02774         osc_list_maint(cli, obj);
02775 
02776         while (!list_empty(&list)) {
02777                 int rc;
02778 
02779                 ext = list_entry(list.next, struct osc_extent, oe_link);
02780                 list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
02781 
02782                 /* extent may be in OES_ACTIVE state because inode mutex
02783                  * is released before osc_io_end() in file write case */
02784                 if (ext->oe_state != OES_TRUNC)
02785                         osc_extent_wait(env, ext, OES_TRUNC);
02786 
02787                 rc = osc_extent_truncate(ext, index, partial);
02788                 if (rc < 0) {
02789                         if (result == 0)
02790                                 result = rc;
02791 
02792                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, ext,
02793                                         "truncate error %d\n", rc);
02794                 } else if (ext->oe_nr_pages == 0) {
02795                         osc_extent_remove(ext);
02796                 } else {
02797                         /* this must be an overlapped extent which means only
02798                          * part of pages in this extent have been truncated.
02799                          */
02800                         EASSERTF(ext->oe_start <= index, ext,
02801                                  "trunc index = %lu/%d.\n", index, partial);
02802                         /* fix index to skip this partially truncated extent */
02803                         index = ext->oe_end + 1;
02804                         partial = false;
02805 
02806                         /* we need to hold this extent in OES_TRUNC state so
02807                          * that no writeback will happen. This is to avoid
02808                          * BUG 17397.
02809                          * Only partial truncate can reach here, if @size is
02810                          * not zero, the caller should provide a valid @extp. */
02811                         LASSERT(*extp == NULL);
02812                         *extp = osc_extent_get(ext);
02813                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext,
02814                                         "trunc at "LPU64"\n", size);
02815                 }
02816                 osc_extent_put(env, ext);
02817         }
02818         if (waiting != NULL) {
02819                 int rc;
02820 
02821                 /* ignore the result of osc_extent_wait the write initiator
02822                  * should take care of it. */
02823                 rc = osc_extent_wait(env, waiting, OES_INV);
02824                 if (rc < 0)
02825                         OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, waiting, "error: %d.\n", rc);
02826 
02827                 osc_extent_put(env, waiting);
02828                 waiting = NULL;
02829                 goto again;
02830         }
02831         RETURN(result);
02832 }
02833 
02837 void osc_cache_truncate_end(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_extent *ext)
02838 {
02839         if (ext != NULL) {
02840                 struct osc_object *obj = ext->oe_obj;
02841                 bool unplug = false;
02842 
02843                 EASSERT(ext->oe_nr_pages > 0, ext);
02844                 EASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_TRUNC, ext);
02845                 EASSERT(!ext->oe_urgent, ext);
02846 
02847                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_CACHE, ext, "trunc -> cache.\n");
02848                 osc_object_lock(obj);
02849                 osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_CACHE);
02850                 if (ext->oe_fsync_wait && !ext->oe_urgent) {
02851                         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
02852                         list_move_tail(&ext->oe_link, &obj->oo_urgent_exts);
02853                         unplug = true;
02854                 }
02855                 osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_WRITE, ext->oe_nr_pages);
02856                 osc_object_unlock(obj);
02857                 osc_extent_put(env, ext);
02858 
02859                 if (unplug)
02860                         osc_io_unplug_async(env, osc_cli(obj), obj);
02861         }
02862 }
02863 
02873 int osc_cache_wait_range(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_object *obj,
02874                          pgoff_t start, pgoff_t end)
02875 {
02876         struct osc_extent *ext;
02877         pgoff_t index = start;
02878         int     result = 0;
02879         ENTRY;
02880 
02881 again:
02882         osc_object_lock(obj);
02883         ext = osc_extent_search(obj, index);
02884         if (ext == NULL)
02885                 ext = first_extent(obj);
02886         else if (ext->oe_end < index)
02887                 ext = next_extent(ext);
02888         while (ext != NULL) {
02889                 int rc;
02890 
02891                 if (ext->oe_start > end)
02892                         break;
02893 
02894                 if (!ext->oe_fsync_wait) {
02895                         ext = next_extent(ext);
02896                         continue;
02897                 }
02898 
02899                 EASSERT(ergo(ext->oe_state == OES_CACHE,
02900                              ext->oe_hp || ext->oe_urgent), ext);
02901                 EASSERT(ergo(ext->oe_state == OES_ACTIVE,
02902                              !ext->oe_hp && ext->oe_urgent), ext);
02903 
02904                 index = ext->oe_end + 1;
02905                 osc_extent_get(ext);
02906                 osc_object_unlock(obj);
02907 
02908                 rc = osc_extent_wait(env, ext, OES_INV);
02909                 if (result == 0)
02910                         result = rc;
02911                 osc_extent_put(env, ext);
02912                 goto again;
02913         }
02914         osc_object_unlock(obj);
02915 
02916         OSC_IO_DEBUG(obj, "sync file range.\n");
02917         RETURN(result);
02918 }
02919 
02929 int osc_cache_writeback_range(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_object *obj,
02930                               pgoff_t start, pgoff_t end, int hp, int discard)
02931 {
02932         struct osc_extent *ext;
02933         struct list_head discard_list = LIST_HEAD_INIT(discard_list);
02934         bool unplug = false;
02935         int result = 0;
02936         ENTRY;
02937 
02938         osc_object_lock(obj);
02939         ext = osc_extent_search(obj, start);
02940         if (ext == NULL)
02941                 ext = first_extent(obj);
02942         else if (ext->oe_end < start)
02943                 ext = next_extent(ext);
02944         while (ext != NULL) {
02945                 if (ext->oe_start > end)
02946                         break;
02947 
02948                 ext->oe_fsync_wait = 1;
02949                 switch (ext->oe_state) {
02950                 case OES_CACHE:
02951                         result += ext->oe_nr_pages;
02952                         if (!discard) {
02953                                 struct list_head *list = NULL;
02954                                 if (hp) {
02955                                         EASSERT(!ext->oe_hp, ext);
02956                                         ext->oe_hp = 1;
02957                                         list = &obj->oo_hp_exts;
02958                                 } else if (!ext->oe_urgent) {
02959                                         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
02960                                         list = &obj->oo_urgent_exts;
02961                                 }
02962                                 if (list != NULL)
02963                                         list_move_tail(&ext->oe_link, list);
02964                                 unplug = true;
02965                         } else {
02966                                 /* the only discarder is lock cancelling, so
02967                                  * [start, end] must contain this extent */
02968                                 EASSERT(ext->oe_start >= start &&
02969                                         ext->oe_max_end <= end, ext);
02970                                 osc_extent_state_set(ext, OES_LOCKING);
02971                                 ext->oe_owner = current;
02972                                 list_move_tail(&ext->oe_link,
02973                                                    &discard_list);
02974                                 osc_update_pending(obj, OBD_BRW_WRITE,
02975                                                    -ext->oe_nr_pages);
02976                         }
02977                         break;
02978                 case OES_ACTIVE:
02979                         /* It's pretty bad to wait for ACTIVE extents, because
02980                          * we don't know how long we will wait for it to be
02981                          * flushed since it may be blocked at awaiting more
02982                          * grants. We do this for the correctness of fsync. */
02983                         LASSERT(hp == 0 && discard == 0);
02984                         ext->oe_urgent = 1;
02985                         break;
02986                 case OES_TRUNC:
02987                         /* this extent is being truncated, can't do anything
02988                          * for it now. it will be set to urgent after truncate
02989                          * is finished in osc_cache_truncate_end(). */
02990                 default:
02991                         break;
02992                 }
02993                 ext = next_extent(ext);
02994         }
02995         osc_object_unlock(obj);
02996 
02997         LASSERT(ergo(!discard, list_empty(&discard_list)));
02998         if (!list_empty(&discard_list)) {
02999                 struct osc_extent *tmp;
03000                 int rc;
03001 
03002                 osc_list_maint(osc_cli(obj), obj);
03003                 list_for_each_entry_safe(ext, tmp, &discard_list, oe_link) {
03004                         list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
03005                         EASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_LOCKING, ext);
03006 
03007                         /* Discard caching pages. We don't actually write this
03008                          * extent out but we complete it as if we did. */
03009                         rc = osc_extent_make_ready(env, ext);
03010                         if (unlikely(rc < 0)) {
03011                                 OSC_EXTENT_DUMP(D_ERROR, ext,
03012                                                 "make_ready returned %d\n", rc);
03013                                 if (result >= 0)
03014                                         result = rc;
03015                         }
03016 
03017                         /* finish the extent as if the pages were sent */
03018                         osc_extent_finish(env, ext, 0, 0);
03019                 }
03020         }
03021 
03022         if (unplug)
03023                 osc_io_unplug(env, osc_cli(obj), obj);
03024 
03025         if (hp || discard) {
03026                 int rc;
03027                 rc = osc_cache_wait_range(env, obj, start, end);
03028                 if (result >= 0 && rc < 0)
03029                         result = rc;
03030         }
03031 
03032         OSC_IO_DEBUG(obj, "pageout [%lu, %lu], %d.\n", start, end, result);
03033         RETURN(result);
03034 }
03035 
03048 int osc_page_gang_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
03049                         struct osc_object *osc, pgoff_t start, pgoff_t end,
03050                         osc_page_gang_cbt cb, void *cbdata)
03051 {
03052         struct osc_page *ops;
03053         void            **pvec;
03054         pgoff_t         idx;
03055         unsigned int    nr;
03056         unsigned int    i;
03057         unsigned int    j;
03058         int             res = CLP_GANG_OKAY;
03059         bool            tree_lock = true;
03060         ENTRY;
03061 
03062         idx = start;
03063         pvec = osc_env_info(env)->oti_pvec;
03064         spin_lock(&osc->oo_tree_lock);
03065         while ((nr = radix_tree_gang_lookup(&osc->oo_tree, pvec,
03066                                             idx, OTI_PVEC_SIZE)) > 0) {
03067                 struct cl_page *page;
03068                 bool end_of_region = false;
03069 
03070                 for (i = 0, j = 0; i < nr; ++i) {
03071                         ops = pvec[i];
03072                         pvec[i] = NULL;
03073 
03074                         idx = osc_index(ops);
03075                         if (idx > end) {
03076                                 end_of_region = true;
03077                                 break;
03078                         }
03079 
03080                         page = ops->ops_cl.cpl_page;
03081                         LASSERT(page->cp_type == CPT_CACHEABLE);
03082                         if (page->cp_state == CPS_FREEING)
03083                                 continue;
03084 
03085                         cl_page_get(page);
03086                         lu_ref_add_atomic(&page->cp_reference,
03087                                           "gang_lookup", current);
03088                         pvec[j++] = ops;
03089                 }
03090                 ++idx;
03091 
03092                 /*
03093                  * Here a delicate locking dance is performed. Current thread
03094                  * holds a reference to a page, but has to own it before it
03095                  * can be placed into queue. Owning implies waiting, so
03096                  * radix-tree lock is to be released. After a wait one has to
03097                  * check that pages weren't truncated (cl_page_own() returns
03098                  * error in the latter case).
03099                  */
03100                 spin_unlock(&osc->oo_tree_lock);
03101                 tree_lock = false;
03102 
03103                 for (i = 0; i < j; ++i) {
03104                         ops = pvec[i];
03105                         if (res == CLP_GANG_OKAY)
03106                                 res = (*cb)(env, io, ops, cbdata);
03107 
03108                         page = ops->ops_cl.cpl_page;
03109                         lu_ref_del(&page->cp_reference, "gang_lookup", current);
03110                         cl_page_put(env, page);
03111                 }
03112                 if (nr < OTI_PVEC_SIZE || end_of_region)
03113                         break;
03114 
03115                 if (res == CLP_GANG_OKAY && need_resched())
03116                         res = CLP_GANG_RESCHED;
03117                 if (res != CLP_GANG_OKAY)
03118                         break;
03119 
03120                 spin_lock(&osc->oo_tree_lock);
03121                 tree_lock = true;
03122         }
03123         if (tree_lock)
03124                 spin_unlock(&osc->oo_tree_lock);
03125         RETURN(res);
03126 }
03127 
03131 static int check_and_discard_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
03132                                 struct osc_page *ops, void *cbdata)
03133 {
03134         struct osc_thread_info *info = osc_env_info(env);
03135         struct osc_object *osc = cbdata;
03136         pgoff_t index;
03137 
03138         index = osc_index(ops);
03139         if (index >= info->oti_fn_index) {
03140                 struct ldlm_lock *tmp;
03141                 struct cl_page *page = ops->ops_cl.cpl_page;
03142 
03143                 /* refresh non-overlapped index */
03144                 tmp = osc_dlmlock_at_pgoff(env, osc, index,
03145                                            OSC_DAP_FL_TEST_LOCK);
03146                 if (tmp != NULL) {
03147                         __u64 end = tmp->l_policy_data.l_extent.end;
03148                         /* Cache the first-non-overlapped index so as to skip
03149                          * all pages within [index, oti_fn_index). This is safe
03150                          * because if tmp lock is canceled, it will discard
03151                          * these pages. */
03152                         info->oti_fn_index = cl_index(osc2cl(osc), end + 1);
03153                         if (end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF)
03154                                 info->oti_fn_index = CL_PAGE_EOF;
03155                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(tmp);
03156                 } else if (cl_page_own(env, io, page) == 0) {
03157                         /* discard the page */
03158                         cl_page_discard(env, io, page);
03159                         cl_page_disown(env, io, page);
03160                 } else {
03161                         LASSERT(page->cp_state == CPS_FREEING);
03162                 }
03163         }
03164 
03165         info->oti_next_index = index + 1;
03166         return CLP_GANG_OKAY;
03167 }
03168 
03169 static int discard_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
03170                       struct osc_page *ops, void *cbdata)
03171 {
03172         struct osc_thread_info *info = osc_env_info(env);
03173         struct cl_page *page = ops->ops_cl.cpl_page;
03174 
03175         /* page is top page. */
03176         info->oti_next_index = osc_index(ops) + 1;
03177         if (cl_page_own(env, io, page) == 0) {
03178                 if (!ergo(page->cp_type == CPT_CACHEABLE,
03179                           !PageDirty(cl_page_vmpage(page))))
03180                         CL_PAGE_DEBUG(D_ERROR, env, page,
03181                                         "discard dirty page?\n");
03182 
03183                 /* discard the page */
03184                 cl_page_discard(env, io, page);
03185                 cl_page_disown(env, io, page);
03186         } else {
03187                 LASSERT(page->cp_state == CPS_FREEING);
03188         }
03189 
03190         return CLP_GANG_OKAY;
03191 }
03192 
03201 int osc_lock_discard_pages(const struct lu_env *env, struct osc_object *osc,
03202                            pgoff_t start, pgoff_t end, enum cl_lock_mode mode)
03203 {
03204         struct osc_thread_info *info = osc_env_info(env);
03205         struct cl_io *io = &info->oti_io;
03206         osc_page_gang_cbt cb;
03207         int res;
03208         int result;
03209 
03210         ENTRY;
03211 
03212         io->ci_obj = cl_object_top(osc2cl(osc));
03213         io->ci_ignore_layout = 1;
03214         result = cl_io_init(env, io, CIT_MISC, io->ci_obj);
03215         if (result != 0)
03216                 GOTO(out, result);
03217 
03218         cb = mode == CLM_READ ? check_and_discard_cb : discard_cb;
03219         info->oti_fn_index = info->oti_next_index = start;
03220         do {
03221                 res = osc_page_gang_lookup(env, io, osc,
03222                                            info->oti_next_index, end, cb, osc);
03223                 if (info->oti_next_index > end)
03224                         break;
03225 
03226                 if (res == CLP_GANG_RESCHED)
03227                         cond_resched();
03228         } while (res != CLP_GANG_OKAY);
03229 out:
03230         cl_io_fini(env, io);
03231         RETURN(result);
03232 }
